results.description:
• What we'll do
Time for another look at the people in software development. Peter Siebel interviews 15 of the top programmers of our time in his book, Coders at Work: Reflections on the Craft of Programming (http://www.codersatwork.com/). They provide insight into how they think, their views on the craft of software development and more. For this event we'll keep it simple and focus on the third and fourth interviews:

1) Douglas Crockford - A senior JavaScript Architect at Yahoo!, Douglas Crockford has been a
programmer since the early ’70s when he took a Fortran course in college after
being unable to get studio time for his major in television broadcasting. Over the
course of his career, he has combined computers with media in various ways at
places like Atari, Lucasfilm, Electric Communities, and now Yahoo! 2) Brendan Eich - Creator of JavaScript, Brendan Eich is now CTO of the
Mozilla Corporation, the subsidiary of the Mozilla Foundation responsible for
continuing development of the Firefox browser. The book is available anywhere you can buy software books online, however feel free to take a peek at the content (http://one-shore.com/aaron/books/coders-at-work.pdf) before deciding whether to dive in.

Please read the specified two interviews in advance of the event so that we can discuss what we read together. They comprise fewer than 90 pages of light reading, but will be critical for participation. The rest of the book is also interesting, so feel free to read more!

The location is Cafe Dudok, in the central area of Den Haag. Seating is limited, so please RSVP early to claim your seat, and keep your RSVP status up to date.

I'm looking forward to our discussion, and if you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to send a message!

• What to bring

• Important to know

Henk Boelman - Beyond the usual suspects, emerging Cognitive Services

In this session, we explore the outer limits of the Cognitive Services universe. Cognitive Services are great for face and objects detection but there is so much more. At the moment, there are over 40 API’s that can add cognitive capabilities to your applications. We dive into a few emerging Cognitive Services technologies in the speech, gestures and knowledge area. Join this session and find out what is out there, beyond the usual suspects.

Joost van Schaik - Remote assets in Mixed Reality

Voorbereiden, uploaden en gebruiken van assets (data, audio/video, hologrammen die in Azure zijn opgeslagen. Normaal zijn alle ‘assets’ ingebakken in de app – Unity biedt ook mogelijkheden assets ‘van elders’ op te halen. Deze sessie laat zien hoe je dat met Azure kunt doen.

21u00 – 21u30 - Borrel

results.description:
Speaker: Paulo Lopes from RedHat

Program

18:00 Doors open and food

19:00 Official Start

21:00 Official End

Abstract:

Do you need to build scalable distributed failure proof low latency microservices but don't know where to start? 

All you need is a Java Virtual Machine. Vert.x 3 combines the power of reactive programming, clusterable message-driven architecture and a polyglot API to make that a reality.

This talk presents the key concepts of Vert.x and how you can use it to build your next application. We will explore the basic concepts of Chaos Engineering and demonstrate as a microservice application can be prepared for the chaos.
I'll illustrate how to prepare a plan, break things so you will be ready when failure comes! Rolling back is not a plan!
results.name: Bringing order to the chaos with Eclipse Vert.x

Interested in Ethereum, blockchain, decentralized apps? Let's come together and talk about all these new developments! It's an exciting time.

TIP: Two days before this meetup is #CRYPT070 at the same location. Don't miss it: https://www.meetup.com/Bitcoin-The-Hague/events/245768632/

We have a first date! Topics are:

🚀 PFLAB POPUP (ALL DAY)

Bring your own tech to share during the day. A new gadget, smart watch, virtual reality app, robot? Share it at this the Permanent Future Lab popup!

Confirmed tech available to try: Homido Mini VR glasses, Trezor Bitcoin Wallet.

🐱 CRYPTOKITTY MARKET PLACE (ALL DAY)

Do you own a cryptokitty? Bring it, print it, trade it. https://www.cryptokitties.co/

💸 WORKSHOP BITCOIN FORKS
----------- 11:00 - 11:45 --------------

There are many forks of Bitcoin these days. If you have Bitcoin, with every fork you'll get 'free money'. But how to redeem it safely?

In this session we will show you how to safely get your new coins after a fork of the Bitcoin blockchain.

If you want to practice during the session -> take the the private key of a small wallet with you, and your laptop. Here you can find out if you have coins to redeem: https://btcdiv.com/

📢 ANNOUNCEMENTS
---------- 15:00 -----------

- New Maker Space at The Hague Tech
- BlockRock podcast
- Start of Blockchain Lab Den Haag
- BYOA (Bring your own announcement ;)

🚀 CODING WITH ETHEREUM ERC721
--------------------- 15:15 ---------------------

Diederik will do a Tech-talk about ERC721: a non-fungible token standard. The token standard is a 'draft', but it's already popularised by CryptoKitties.

Join to learn about the ERC721 basics, applications (kitties, art, cards, etc), wallet implementation + bottlenecks & extensions like IPFS storage.

📺 DEEP DIVE INTO DECRED
------------------ 15:50 -----------------

"Decred is an autonomous digital currency. The project was created to solve the forking problems of Bitcoin and launched in 2016 without ICO or external funding. Its innovative blockchain empowers stakeholders and allows for the seamless transition from one set of consensus rules to another. Stakeholders who participate in decision-making are rewarded for their efforts. The Decred project is committed to release free and open-source code.

------------------ 16:20 ----------------

RSVP if you'd like to join!

results.description:
Op 26 januari is er de fietsinnovatie-meetup/borrel, naar aanleiding van de ideeën van CycleHack. CommonBike is erbij!

CommonBike heeft geen programma dit keer. Kom langs en ontmoet interessante mensen en initiatieven. Specifiek voor een status-update en de doorontwikkeling van CommonBike komt er dit jaar snel weer een event.

____

Vorig jaar resulteerde de eerste Rotterdamse CycleHack in verschillende inspirerende ideeën: BikeBadge, FitsClub, OV-Meetfiets en DAETOUR. De teams zijn nu onderweg van prototype naar product.

Op de Meetup hoor je waar de CycleHackers staan en kun je meedenken over de vervolgstappen om het fietsen in Rotterdam verder te brengen. Ook is er een borrel.

Wat: Netwerken, meedenken en proosten op een nieuw fietsjaar.
Wanneer: Vrijdag 26 januari van 15:00 tot 17:00
Waar: Deltacycling, Vijverhofstraat 122 in Rotterdam.
FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/188687141867940

Tot de 26e!

____

# Topics om te bespreken, voor deze keer of een volgende:

* Plannen common-bike voor nieuwe jaar.

* Kijken of/hoe we samenwerken met Cykl in Wageningen. Aandacht voor Rotterdamse initiatieven die nu al op straat zijn en voor fietsen op zuid.

Dit alles gecombineerd met resultaten van de CycleHack hackathon-projecten en een goede borrel! Enthousiast over fietsen, stedelijke inrichting en mobiliteit? Geïnteresseerd in deelfietsen, e-locks, open platforms en CommonBike? Wees welkom!

# Links:

Facebook-event CycleHack:
https://www.facebook.com/events/188687141867940/

Meer info CycleHack:
http://deltacycling.cc/cyclehackers-willen-meer-fietsers-in-rotterdam/

results.description:
Rescheduled to 8 Feb due to the stormy weather!

• What we'll do
February 8 we'll organise an afternoon to start preparing the Border Labs (this is plural of 'Border Lab') for the upcoming Border Sessions festival 14-16 June, our fabulous tech-society festival in The Hague. Want an impression? Check 2016. or 2017.bordersessions.org

> We've pre-selected a number of people resulting in a list of 14 lab themes*. Check the themes below before registering for the meetup please. We can host only a limited number of extra people, so be quick!

**So what is a lab?**
A lab is a one- or two-day event where people gather around a specific theme or topic. A lab can be serie of inspiring talks, insightful debates and thoughtful discussions, *but* more often a lab is more: it produces tangible results or a project that continues beyond the festival. We are looking for ambitious, passionate people with interest, expertise, skills, or network related with the labs' themes. We now have confirmations for the following 14 labs:
+ Bugs for Food - exploring insects and bugs as a viable food source in Western cuisine
+ Artificial Intelligence for Art/Creatives - with KABK
+ Blockchain for Good - building applications and discussing societal implications of blockchain technology
+ Energy Labs - what's left to explore in the energy domain?
+ Zero Waste Household - Designing a really smart home (one that deals with a real problem)
+ Tech Nature - Intersecting nature and tech focused on autonomous eco-systems and embedded systems to create different interactions with nature
+ Lab Moerwijk - redesign what's next for Moerwijk
+ Biohacking - redesigning nature, redefining humans
+ Rules of Law and Rules of Technology - with the World Justice Project
+ Food & City - how cities will feed themselves
+ GovLab - service design for the government
+ DataCommons - reclaiming your data... how?
+ Biodiversity & Tech - technology to save ecosystems
+ AI in public space - what does the tech offer for better, more social, safer public spaces?

We approach this through co-creation. We facilitate labs in different ways, basically with location and conference logistics (ticketing, potential sponsors and partners, the 10.000+ Border Sessions network), but we will also participate in the organisation of labs substantially, by providing speakers, moderators, and ideas.

Define your lab's mission on February 8!

*Your preferred lab theme not there? No problem: contact thieme@borderlabs.org to submit your lab and we'll let you know if it fits the overall Border Sessions mission.

• What to bring
Good ideas, two bananas, pyjamas, artificial intelligence.

• Important to know
Program will be sent by email, let us know if you come by registering for the event!
results.how_to_find_us: next to CS
results.name: Border Sessions 2018: Co-create your next Border Lab

results.description:
Spreker: Jeroen Meetsma is mede-oprichter van Boncode Software Remediation en heeft zich gespecialiseerd in softwarekwaliteit en software architectuur. Hij heeft een tool ontwikkeld om softwarekwaliteit te meten en werkt nu aan een analyse die architectuur in een implementatie zichtbaar maakt. Jeroen heeft aan de basis gestaan van de ontwikkeling van enkele vooraanstaande platforms.

In deze sessie verkennen we de raakvlakken tussen kwaliteit van broncode en security. Kwaliteit van broncode wordt doorgaans afgebakend onder de noemer onderhoudbaarheid van de ISO 25010 beschrijving van software kwaliteit. Onderhoudbaarheid is vrij goed te meten. Een globaal beeld geeft al veel inzicht. Security assessments van maatwerk software vergen een andere aanpak, omdat elk lek, elke kwetsbaarheid er één te veel is. Bovendien hangt veel af van de infrastructuur en gehanteerde procedures. Toch is er op een aantal punten een belangrijke overlap tussen onderhoudbaarheid en security. Jeroen Meetsma zal drie ervan uiteenzetten en geeft vervolgens alle ruimte voor vragen en discussie.

The presentation will be in Dutch

Programma:

18:00 Doors open - dinner (chinese) & drinks

19:00 Session begins!

21:00 Official end, have a chat/drink
results.name: Security assessments and Software quality

results.description:
For the second session in our ICS Security Virtual Meeting series, Bryan Singer and Emmet Moore III take us Inside the Control System – Components, Processes, and Automation

February 22, 2018

2 CPE Credits available for attendees

This session covers hardware, software, systems, information flow and operations unique to these environments (to include PLC’s, HMIs, Historians, Field Devices, Controller devices, Operating Systems (yes Microsoft)). We will cover basic network structure and design architecture related to technical components (PLC, HMIs, Field devices, etc.) and information. The variety of control system architectures across various sectors (electrical, manufacturing, transportation, health, etc.) will be addressed.

This session will address questions including:
- What components are found inside a control or operating technology system?
- What is process control?
- What is a set point or a flow point?
- What are an engineering Safety Systems?
- What are the primary directives for these systems?
- What differentiates these components from their IT equivalents?

Register now at https://www.cs2ai.org/virtual-meeting-series/
(Also to watch recorded sessions!)

Discussion Leader: Bryan Singer

Bryan has an extensive background in a variety of industries including manufacturing, DoD, healthcare, and others. His proven professional skills include system architecture and design, software project management, application development, system administration, network administration, database design and administration, and multi-tier support. Previously he was the chairman of ISA-62443/ISA-99 Industrial Control Systems Security Standards body; Interim Governing Board, for the Process Control Security Forum; and an industry representative for security architecture concerns to almost every major manufacturing, utilities, and other critical infrastructure. His specialties are: 1) System Architecture and Design using methodologies including UML, Rational Unified Process, Booch, Yourdon, etc.; 2) MES, EAI, ERP, LIMS, PLC, DCS, HMI, and other manufacturing systems; 3) Client/Server development in Java, JSP, ASP, C/C++, Visual C++, VB, PERL, Shell (ksh, csh, sh, bash), SQL, PL/SQL, and HTML; 4) Physical and network vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, information assurance, and biometrics, and; 5) • PGP, SSH, VPN, WEP, SSL, WAP, 802.1x, RADIUS, etc
https://www.linkedin.com/in/bryanlsinger/

Discussion Leader: Emmett Moore

Emmett is the founder and CEO of Red Trident Inc.. Over the years, he has focused on Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Research, and Security Services. He has been responsible for all aspects of the product development life cycle in the Oil & Gas Industry. As a project specialist he handled a multitude of roles, which included managing high level automation projects for the oil and gas industry, as well as being a technical specialist various other projects.
https://www.linkedin.com/in/emooreiii/

results.description:
Bij het ontwikkelen van nieuwe producten gaat het er niet langer om dat je een ‘goed’ product ontwikkeld, het gaat om het juiste product. De enige manier om daar achter te komen is om dit te toetsen. Hoe eerder hoe beter. Niets is meer waardevol dan iets tastbaars in de handen van jouw gebruikers. Dit is waar een prototype mindset je bij kan helpen.

Een prototype mindset vergt een andere aanpak: van ‘pixel-perfect’ naar ‘goed genoeg om te testen’ en van degelijke lange termijn oplossingen naar quick and dirty.

Prototyping is een tool, een proces, maar vooral een manier van werken.
We gaan het deze avond hebben over:
› Wat een prototype mindset jou en je team kan opleveren
› Hoe ver je moet gaan met een prototype
› Hoe je alles kan prototypen in max. 1 dag

Programma:
17:00 inloop, pizza en bier
17:15 presentatie
18:00 napraten/discussie
18:30 borrel

results.name: Fake it! Waarom een prototyping mindset essentieel is voor elk innovatie team

Welcome to Vierde vrijdag! = The monthly meetup for sharing knowledge, inspiration, (co)working on projects & talks in the afternoon!

PROGRAM
==========

10:00 Be welcome to meet & (co)work, have an informal gathering, create your mini-hackathon...

🍟 LUNCH
--- 13:00 ---

Bring your own, visit a bar or have some salad/bread/fries at The Hague Tech for 5 EUR only.

📢 ANNOUNCEMENTS
---------- 15:00 -----------

- BlockRock: Learnings about setting up a podcast
- Update on #blockbar: The blockchain lab at The Hague Tech
- New Maker Space at The Hague Tech
- Announcement: AI Lab @ The Hague Tech!
- BYOA (Bring your own announcement ;)

# AI DISRUPTION
------- 15:30 -------

AI gaat de wereld veranderen. Zowel op een positieve als negatieve manier. Blijf op de hoogte, dan weet je wat het is en hoe je het op de maximale manier in je voordeel kunt gebruiken.

We gaan praten over de huidige technologie en wat het in de toekomst kan gaan betekenen.

"Wat gaat kunstmatige intelligentie eigenlijk voor jou betekenen?" door Ahmed .

results.description:
• What we'll do
Hoe heroveren we de zeggenschap over onze data? Data delen biedt veel kansen en nieuwe mogelijkheden. Maar hoe organiseer je dat je zelf zeggenschap houdt over het delen van je data? Op 7 maart organiseren Maakbaar en DataCommons samen een meetup over technische oplossingen om data te delen op jouw voorwaarden. Het doel van de vereniging DataCommons is om te komen tot een open architectuur waarmee verschillende niveaus van data-controle kunnen worden geïmplementeerd. Deze architectuur kan misschien met behulp van blockchain-achtige technologieën ‘hard’ worden afgedwongen, maar kan ook geïmplementeerd worden in een ‘zachter’ permissie-systeem, gebaseerd op het vertrouwen in de aanbieder van de digitale dienst. In deze meetup onderzoeken we architecturen en oplossingsrichtingen. Ook gaan we op zoek naar pilots waarin we de architectuur in de praktijk kunnen uittesten. Vereniging DataCommons streeft naar een infrastructuur waarin jij bepaalt onder welke voorwaarden jij je data deelt. Denk en doe je mee? Welkom op 7 maart in Maakbaar, Prinsenkwartier van 1700 uur - 1900 uur.
• What to bring

• Important to know
zie ook www.datacommons.nl
results.name: Data delen op jouw voorwaarden: de architectuur

results.description:
Op 15 maart 2018 vindt voor de zestiende keer een Scrum Round Table plaats. Het onderwerp voor deze Scrum Round Table is Team Empowerment.

In een traditonele organisatie worden de meeste beslissingen genomen door managers. Maar hoe gaat dat in een Agile organisatie? Wat moet een manager nog beslissen en welke beslissingen leg je bij het team neer? Tijdens de Scrum Round Table op 15 maart gaan we in op een manier op basis waarvan je kunt bepalen waar welke verantwoordelijk hoort.

Over Scrum Round Tables
Om met vakgenoten ervaringen uit te wisselen op het vlak van Scrum organiseert Delta-N vier keer per jaar een Scrum Round Table. Dit zijn interactieve sessies met 12 tot 16 deelnemers, gericht op het delen van praktijkervaringen met scrum. Iedere round table heeft een specifiek thema waarover in een interactieve setting gediscussieerd wordt. Er staat ook altijd een Scrum game rond het thema op het programma. De sessies worden begeleid door ervaren DevOps Consultants / Scrum Masters. Kijk voor het exacte programma op https://www.delta-n.nl/scrumroundtable
results.name: Scrum Round Table - Team Empowerment

results.description:
• What we'll do
At the inaugural AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

Schedule:
18:00 doors open, pizza and drinks served
19:00 first talk
19:45 second talk

The first talk:

Speaker: Farley (OlinData)
Title: Migrating data from tapes into Amazon Glacier
Description: How much does your data backup solution cost you in both effort and cost? We're going to dig into what it took to migrate 280TB of data the Naturalis museum in Leiden had from tapes into Amazon Glacier. We will go over the planning, execution, monitoring, verification, and closing out of this project. We'll share our knowledge and lessons learned which you can use as a starting point to do your own data migration.

Speaker: Ionut Dragoi (ex-Amazon Web Services Managed Services)
Title: Unit-testing for Boto3, the AWS python library
Description: We all know that testing the code we write is very important.
This is because we want to make sure that the code is actually doing what it is supposed to.
When it comes to complex systems, made up of multiple services interacting with each other,
the first tests that comes to mind are the functional, integration tests, that make sure the whole system is working as expected using real input and output. But how about testing smaller individual pieces of code? How do we make sure they are operating properly? And how do you do it when those small pieces of code are interacting with network services, like external API calls? One answer for this is mocking these external requests and in this session we will find out how can we use Python's mock library to unit test a function using boto3 to make AWS API calls.
Also, we will see how these unit tests can be automated by integrating them in a pipeline.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza, sponsored by SumoLogic

results.description:
17u30 – 18u30 - Binnenkomst
18u00 – 18u30 - Eten
18u30 – 18u45 - Revenue

18u45 – 19u45
Building a shared HoloLens experience
Elke HoloLens ervaring is bijzonder, maar een gedeelde ervaring is pas echt uniek. Daarom leggen we in deze sessie uit hoe je een gedeelde ervaring ontwikkelt waarin 2 of meer devices hun wereld “delen”.In deze sessie behandelen we de basics van een gedeelde HoloLens ervaring:

De theorie, hoe delen HoloLens devices hun coordinaatsysteem.
Welke tools zijn er beschikbaar?
Het opzetten van een basis gedeelde ervaring
Uitdagingen en aandachspunten

Level:[masked] – Beginner/Intermediate
Type: Development
Spreker: Tom Verhoeff

19u45 – 20u00 - Pauze

20u00 – 21u00
Neuro Navigation with HoloLens
Als een van de eersten in Nederland had Info Support in 2016 de HoloLens in handen. Inmiddels werken we aan applicaties om de HoloLens te kunnen toepassen voor en tijdens complexe operaties. Het interactief analyseren van het menselijk lichaam, gebaseerd op MRI-, PAT- en CT-scans, blijkt een enorme positieve impact te hebben op de effectiviteit van de operatie en het verlagen van de tijd dat een patiënt op de operatietafel ligt. Tevens zijn kostenverlagingen mogelijk door toepassing van de HoloLens.

In deze presentatie tonen we de stand van zaken van een project dat Info Support uitvoert met het BTI (Brain Technology Institute) van het UMC (Utrecht Medisch Centrum). Hiermee beogen we de toepassing van de HoloLens voor 3D neuronavigatie, als alternatief voor bestaande doch dure 2D apparatuur.

Level:[masked] – Beginner/Intermediate
Type: Functioneel
Spreker: Tom Mensink

21u00 – 21u30 - Borrel

Meer informatie op de website van de MIxUG.
https://www.mixug.com/mixug-evenement-maart-2018/

results.description:
Donderdag 22 maart organiseren we de volgende Replastic workshop over zelf te maken machines voor hergebruik van plastic. Dit is een vervolg op de workshop over het proces van hergebruik met Community Plastics.
Tijdens de workshop vertellen verschillende initiatieven in Den Haag over hun plannen en huidige activiteiten voor het maken en inzetten van hun machines. Wat gebeurt er al, wat zijn de beste machines om mee te starten, wat zijn de knelpunten bij het bouwen, hoe kunnen we samen een machinepark zijn, welke ondersteuning kunnen we met elkaar bieden en hoe gaan we de kinderen van de basisschool De Grote Beer erbij betrekken? Ook worden de ervaringen gedeeld bij het bezoek van een fabrikant van machines voor plastic verzameling.
Deze workshop wordt georganiseerd door Lab Moerwijk in samenwerking met Haagse Makers, Made in Moerwijk, Soco Soco en Replastic initiatieven in Den Haag.

results.description:
Ben jij van plan om binnenkort een GV Sprint te doen binnen jouw organisatie en heb je het boek al gelezen? Wij helpen je graag een goede start te maken. Theorie is één, maar in de praktijk pakt het vaak toch net wat anders uit. 😉 Tijdens deze Thirsty Thursday delen we alle ingrediënten met jullie voor een geslaagde Sprint.

Om onze workshop zo relevant mogelijk te maken, zijn we heel benieuwd naar jullie eigen vragen. Bereid je vragen voor en we gaan er tijdens de workshop samen mee aan de slag.

Onderwerpen die we gaan behandelen zijn bijvoorbeeld:
• Hoe kies je de juiste probleemstelling?
• Kan deze ook te groot of te klein zijn?
• Wat is het optimale team?
• Hoe werf je de juiste respondenten in korte tijd?
• Is het voor elke organisatie plug & play?

We sluiten de avond af met een interactieve quiz: wanneer is een GV Sprint geschikt, maar wanneer ook niet? De winnaar gaat naar huis met een mooie prijs! 😉 🍾

Programma
17:00 Ontvangst: Pizza & Bier
17:20 Deel 1: onze learnings & beantwoorden van vragen
18:00 Pauze
18:10 Deel 2: Quiz & prijsuitkering
18:30 Afsluiting & Borrel
results.how_to_find_us: We zitten in ronde toren bij het oude Haagse vliegveld Ypenburg ✈️
results.name: GV sprint in praktijk: onze ervaringen uit 20 sprints 🍻 + 🍕+ 🤓

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HCbjZXfKSvk
We are kicking off our first meetup in the year.

Talk # 1
Jasper Moelker (Voorhoede) - Deep Dive into Progress Web Applications.
Jasper along with his team at Voorhoede made it there goal to make every project they touched a Progress Web Application.
(https://www.voorhoede.nl/en/blog/every-project-a-progressive-web-app/ )

Talk #2
Bart Waardenburg(ANWB) - Creating a (p)react component library
Working with multiple teams on multiple applications brings a whole new set of challenges to software development. Which code do you share, where do you draw the line and how do you work together keeping a certain amount of consistency. At the ANWB we’re currently tackling these problems and building a component library using (p)react. 1. The need for a structured component library. The tradeoffs between complete developer freedom and a rigid code regime.
2. I want to share our learnings on how to use React or Preact on a generic component level and our decisions to move from React to Preact.
3. How to build and use an individually versioned component system using tools like Lerna and Storybook.
4. Challenges for the future
(https://medium.com/@BartWaardenburg/creating-a-react-component-library-using-storybook-e7c3fd105fd5)

ABOUT THE SPONSOR
Worth Internet Systems(https://worth.systems)

For over 15 years, Worth Internet Systems has helped businesses and public sector organisations design, build and implement digital transformation solutions. As a strategic change partner, we work with clients in government, education, science, health and business to optimise customer and user experience, transform operational processes and create dynamic new business models. Using open source software and cloud tools, we develop flexible, agile solutions focused on the user. Our solutions incorporate intuitive interfaces, user-centric journeys and high levels of integration.

Worth is a full-service digital agency based near Reading in the UK and The Hague in The Netherlands. Our team of more than 70 professionals has the business skills to develop strategy and the specialist technical expertise to deliver every phase of the project from concept, through development, user experience, testing and deployment. Using agile techniques, DevOps and high levels of automation, we deliver projects quickly and cost-effectively.

results.description:
GOOD FRIDAY SPECIAL: INSTALL A MARKET MAKER ON A RASPBERRY PI !

BarterDEX is a new, decentralized exchange for trading cryptocurrencies. You can offer liquidity and in exchange earn some money. In this workshop you'll become a Liquidity Provider using BarterDEX.

₿----------₿

Join us for a workshop to get started with BarterDEX, the liquidity provider of Komodo Platform (KMD). In this workshop, you will learn to set up your own liquidity provider and become your own market maker. You will learn how to trade using atomic swaps on the decentralized exchange BarterDEX running from your very own Raspberry Pi.

Built by Komodo, the world-leader in atomic swap technology, BarterDEX offers a decentralized tool (dApp) that allows anyone to make a coin conversion request of bitcoin- and Ethereum based tokens, finding a suitable match and complete the trade using an atomic cross-chain protocol. An atomic swap is a peer-to-peer trade of one cryptocurrency directly for another, without any direct IP contact between the two nodes or the use of an intermediary party.

Curious how the future of instant wallet-to-wallet trading will be? Come and build (the future)!

The workshop can be joined for free and will be run by bartwr, barv & diesmaster, open source enthusiasts and decentralized blockchain experts. Sign up to secure your spot.

We'll live stream the event on D.live: https://dlive.io/@artakush !

You can find a podcast on the event through our broadcasting partner Blockrock.nl: http://www.blockrock.nl.

This workshop is hosted by Blockbar (Blockchain Lab The Hague) and an example for future events sponsored by Komodo Pioneers.

Be your own market maker!

🏦 WHO IS IT FOR

It is recommended that you have some knowledge of cryptocurrency wallets and transactions. You don’t have to be a developer.

🏦 WHAT WILL YOU NEED

Obviously you need a Raspberry Pi if you want to run BarterDEX on it.

If you don’t have a Raspberry Pi, it is fun if you buy one (Pi 3). You can get them for less than 50 Euros. Find places to buy the RASPBERRY PI 3 MODEL B+: https://www.raspberrypi.org/products/raspberry-pi-3-model-b-plus/#buy-now-modal. Be sure to also bring an accompanying SD card (16 Gb).

You can also just bring your laptop and we’ll go from there.

🏦 ABOUT KOMODO PLATFORM

The Komodo project focuses on empowering users with freedom through blockchain technology. One of their powerful technologies is a new method of trading cryptocurrencies directly from one person to another through decentralized exchanges. BarterDEX, has been used to perform more than 80,000 Atomic Swaps by real-world users. http://www.komodoplatform.com

🏦 MORE

Learn more about this workshop:
https://slides.com/bartwr/blockbar-barterdex-lp-workshop/

> A liquidity provider (LP) is a trading party that acts as a market maker buying and selling assets. They provide liquidity to the exchange, and make their profit from the spread between bid and ask orders. LP's bring price stability and make easier for traders to execute trades.

Download BarterDEX:
https://komodoplatform.com/decentralized-exchange/

BarterDEX documentation:
http://barterdex.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Getting Started with BarterDEX:
https://youtu.be/IKByQaRys0w

BarterDEX is in beta and in heavy development. Be an early adopter :-)

🏦 LOCATION: THE HAGUE TECH

Blockbar is located at The Hague Tech, a tech community in The Hague, reach it in 5 minutes (by foot) from Central Station. This workshop will be in the workshop space on the 3rd floor.

₿----------₿

Previous meetups:

https://www.meetup.com/blockbar/events/past

• What we'll do
At our second AWS Meetup The Hague we'll shake things up and have a quiz and a talk. This is all accompanied by ome beer and pizza. The first talk:

Quizmaster: Jonah
Title: Cloud architecture (pub) quiz
Description: Are you planning on getting your AWS certification any time soon? Are you already certified and feel that you have what it takes to compete with your peers?
Then tonight is for you! Meetups usually only consist of a few talks and the opportunity to drink beer and eat pizza. This time we’re going to shake things up a little.
Instead of a regular talk, we are going to do a Cloud Architecture pubquiz! Over the course of an hour you will get your chance to shine!

The talk:

Speaker: Gérard de Vos
Title: "There is something about serverless"
Description: Serverless is not just a silly name, it promises a new way of computing where we truly use it as a utility and pay per byte and compute second and not for the VMs and VHDs we spin up. This talk covers some of the What and the How but most importantly the Why.
It's got slides used for managers, some for developers and if the demo gods are appeased a demo.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

results.description:
Programma
=====================================

18:00 Deuren open & eten
19:00 Talk 1: "Waar staat blockchain nu" door Henk van Cann
19:45 Pauze
20:00 Talk 2: "Komodo root nodes" door Bart van Maarseveen

Talk 1:
De bitcoin als currency kende vlak voor kerst onlogisch grote hoogten en blijft momenteel onlogisch in een laagte hangen; vindt Henk van Cann. Hoe kunnen we dit rijmen: in maatschappelijke zin de opmars van bitcoin (in steeds meer landen adoptie, steeds meer decentrale architecturen en de jeugd is niet van het speculeren en uitproberen te houden) en in technische zin het Lightning Network, atomic swaps en interoperabiliteit. De koers zou juist nu door het dak kunnen vliegen. Waarom niet. Hoe kan dat.

Waar staat Blockchain nu? Wat deed en doet de hype rondom cryptocurrencies en zijn use-cases van blockchain nu echt zinnig?! Antwoord op de laatste vraag is een volmondig 'ja'. Kom naar de meetup voor de andere antwoorden en hoe je jezelf in de wereld kunt verrijken ... met kennis!

=====================

Talk 2:
Bitcoin staat op eenzame hoogte op het vlak van bewezen veiligheid en robuustheid. Betekent dit dat de rol van andere blockchains experimenteel en voorlopig beperkt bruikbaar is?

Bart van Maarseveen licht aan de hand van een sprekend voorbeeld uit hoe blockchains complementair met elkaar kunnen werken waardoor een krachtig ecosysteem duidelijk wordt en zich voor de luisteraars een nieuwe toepassing voor bitcoin openbaart. Een toepassing met een ongekende potentie.

Bio
===
Bart van Maarseveen (@bvanmaarseveen) heeft een verleden met open source en internet technologie dat terug gaat tot begin jaren 90. Vanuit die wereld waren de cryptografie en de honger naar digitaal geld nooit ver weg. Door alle digitaal geld mislukkingen uit het verleden eerst nog sceptisch, maar in 2016 kwam het besef dat het dit keer allemaal klopte. Vanaf dat jaar heeft Bart besloten zich volledig te richten op de kansen en communities binnen deze nieuwe wereld met de open source gedachte als moreel kompas.

Bart adviseert organisaties over (blockchains) innovatie en organiseert open teams ter realisatie. Daarnaast is hij de initiator van Blockrock, een podcast-serie over de nederlandse blockchain mensen, projecten & organisaties en is hij betrokken bij de organisatie van open blockchain labs in Den Haag en Amsterdam.
===

Bio
===
Henk van Cann (@henkvancann) heeft zich sinds 2013 in blockchain technologie verdiept. Sinds 2016 is hij volledig gefocust op blockchain toepassingen voor vraagstukken waar e-identity een rol speelt (je digitale ‘ik’). Hij leerde “hard” van de bitcoin. Van Cann spreekt met passie over het 'wat', het 'hoe', maar vooral het 'waarom' van de toevallige uitvinding blockchain. Henk vertelt op een inzichtelijke manier hoe blockchains werken en wat het voor je kan betekenen. En ook: hoe kun je in deze nieuwe wereld zelf het kaf van het koren in berichtgeving en meningen leert scheiden. In interactieve presentaties geeft Van Cann voorbeelden van andere toepassingen dan alleen geld. Steeds hopend dat er een paar vonkjes vrij komen of vlammetjes gaan branden over de mogelijkheden van deze technologie binnen het eigen werk en privé bij aanwezigen.

In het verleden was Henk ondernemer in GIS, bouwde een bedrijf van vijfentwintig mensen op de loonlijst. Later bouwde hij een bedrijf op in open source CMS systemen dat enkel werkte met een team van zelfstandige kleine bedrijven. He verkocht de twee bedrijven achtereenvolgens in 1999 en 2016.
results.name: Waar staat Blockchain nu?...

results.description:
On May 25th 2018 the new General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) will come into force (AVG in Dutch). Find out the most important changes for your organisation.

The GDPR is a law that applies to all businesses that process the personal data of EU citizens. The law was developed because the EU wishes to create a uniform, secure, European digital environment. As soon as a company processes personal data, the people concerned must have access to their own data. It must be easy to rectify mistakes in one’s own data. Furthermore, it must be possible to delete and export data.

It seems that 97% of companies don’t have a plan in place for when GDPR kicks off in 2018, while it will have implications on marketing and sales activities. Would you like to know how prepared your organisation is regarding the legal AVG / GDPR requirements, and how to prepare from them? Cor den Boer and Jeremy Bode (ICT Architect) and (Senior Data Protection Officer bij DPO Consultancy) will prepare you for the new privacy regulations.

results.name: What you need to know about the GDPR

Join us for a presentation and discussion on the various applications of AI in astronomy and space exploration!

We organize the event together with our sister community - Space Explorers NL (https://www.meetup.com/Space-Explorers-NL/)

Disclaimer: the session will be slightly technically oriented, but a high School level knowledge of mathematics should suffice.

results.description:
Frontend 2018 Part II
Hosted @ Dept.(Rotterdam)

As per usual drinks and pizza will be available.

The Talks:

Hidde de Vries
"How we can now do lots of cool graphic design using CSS"'

The web is ready for great graphic design

Some of the world's greatest print design was made on known canvases, with known content using known color options. On the web, we have more flexible tools. Media queries, flexible units, Grid Layout and Flexbox let us do great graphic design. With flexibility.

In this talk Hidde will show some of the CSS that puts great graphic design into practice on the web. Get inspired by some of the icons from the history of graphic design, while learning new properties that you can use in projects today.

*Hidde de Vries (@hdv) is a front-end web developer. On his blog he writes about HTML, CSS, JavaScript and accessibility. As a freelancer, he helps governments, organisations and companies with fast, scalable and accessible front-end solutions for their end users.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Diego Chávez
"React Sweet 16(XO)"

"Finally all the features from your dreams appear from a magic portal, there are no error boundaries, there are pure fragments of love, every custom DOM attribute has a special place in the heart of static html. - -
- React Sweet 16

Diego will take your on a tour of React[masked]). Which with its updates included: fragments, error boundaries, portals, support for custom DOM attributes, improved server-side rendering, and reduced file size.

*Diego Chávez (@diegochavez) is a front-end web developer from Guatemala . Skateboarder. Prefers React over AngularJS, but does Angular really good.
results.name: Frontend 2018 Part II ( CSS vs React(JS) )

results.description:
Computer vision deals with how computers can gain high-level understanding from digital images or videos. From the perspective of engineering, it seeks to automate tasks that the human visual system can do.

Computer vision tasks include methods for acquiring, processing, analyzing and understanding digital images, and extraction of high-dimensional data from the real world in order to produce numerical or symbolic information, e.g., in the forms of decisions.

Do you want to hear more on the topic? Join us on 23rd May when will we are hosting a workshop on computer vision!

Herbert from Fizyr, previous Amazon Picking Challenge winner, is #1 in automated parcel picking from bulk. They made a Keras implementation of RetinaNet on TensorFlow for object detection. Many multinationals including apply their deep learning software for identification, Quality Control and 6DOF grasping.

Jannes Klaas will dive deeper into the technical aspects of computer vision. He will explain the iteration of the computer vision pipeline with Keras and OpenCV on the example of seedlings classification.

Agenda:
18:00 - Doors Open
18:30 - First talk + Q&A
19:10 - Break
19:30 - Second talk + Q&A
20:10- Networking drinks
results.name: Automation in Logistics and Agriculture - Computer vision workshop

results.description:
The evening will start at 18:00, where you can grab a drink and we will enjoy dinner together. This will give you a chance to share your thoughts with other developers and connect with new people.

At 19:00 the Techtalk will start, multiple speakers will talk about different topics.

Bjørn Wikkeling will talk about Artificial intelligence (AI)
"Artificial intelligence is intelligence demonstrated by machines, in contrast to the natural intelligence displayed by humans and other animals. In this presentation, we will dive deeper into the world of AI."

Jeroen will talk about Blockchain
"Blockchain is a continuously growing list of records, called blocks, which are linked and secured using cryptography."

Raymon will do a presentation about Javascript Intersection Observers
"The Intersection Observer API provides a way to asynchronously observe changes in the intersection of a target element with an ancestor element or with a top-level document's viewport."

And last but not least, Fernando will talk about Artificial Neural Networks
"Artificial neural networks (ANNs) are computing systems vaguely inspired by the biological neural networks that constitute animal brains. Such systems "learn" (progressively improve performance on) tasks by considering examples, generally without task-specific programming."
results.name: Competa Techtalk May

results.description:
------------------------------------------------
Datum: Donderdag 14 juni | 08:30 – 18:00
Trainers: Esther Wieringa en Matthijs Zwinderman
Early Bird tickets (ex. BTW): € 480,-
Aanmelden via https://www.eventbrite.nl/e/tickets-design-sprint-crash-course-45342842663
------------------------------------------------

Conceptontwikkeling is iets dat weken of zelfs maanden in beslag kan nemen. Maar waarom zoveel kostbare tijd besteden, zonder te weten of je de juiste kant op gaat? Fail fast, learn faster. Met een design sprint, beperk je maanden werk tot slechts 5 dagen.

Binnen één week ga je van niets naar volledig nieuw concept gevalideerd met gebruikers.

De design sprint, ontwikkeld door Google Ventures, is dé manier om nieuwe concepten te ontwikkelen in een markt die constant in beweging is. Het geeft je de kant om risico’s te nemen en je meest gedurfde ideeën direct te testen met jouw gebruikers.

Wat ga je leren?
Tijdens deze crash course leer je over het volledige sprint proces waarmee we al meer dan 30 innovatieve concepten ontwikkelden samen met klanten als SNS Bank, FOX-IT, International Baccalaureate, Proagrica, Pronexus en Reed Business.

Wij geloven in een hands-on aanpak als de beste manier om te leren. Je gaat dus vooral zelf aan de slag. We oefenen in kleine groepjes, gebruiken voorbeelden uit de praktijk en hebben veel ruimte voor jouw vragen.

> Stap voor stap uitleg van het sprint proces
> Zelf aan de slag met de meest belangrijke oefeningen
> Hoe maak je snel beslissingen, zonder discussies

Tips en tricks uit de praktijk: wat hadden wij graag willen weten voor onze eerste sprint

De missende hoofdstukken uit het boek: wat komt er vóór en na de design sprint?

Aan het eind van de dag weet je wanneer, hoe en waarom je een Design Sprint in zou zetten.

Esther Wieringa en Matthijs Zwinderman faciliteerden samen al meer dan 30 design sprints. Zij kunnen tijdens de crash course al jullie vragen over design sprints beantwoorden en delen maar al te graag al hun ervaringen uit de praktijk.

Voor wie?
Deze workshop is niet alleen voor designers! Iedereen die werkt binnen product ontwikkeling of innovatie kan aan de slag met deze methode. Deze workshop is perfect voor: Product owners / Start-up founders / Designers / Team-leads / Product managers / Innovatie-managers;

Iedereen die geïnteresseerd is in het sneller ontwikkelen van innovatieve producten.

Schrijf je in
Binnenkort zelf aan de slag met design sprints? Schrijf je dan nu in via Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.nl/e/tickets-design-sprint-crash-course-45342842663

Meer informatie of liever betalen op factuur? Neem contact met ons op: https://www.angistudio.com/contact.html
results.name: Design Sprint - Crash Course

results.description:
Op 14 juni 2018 vindt voor de zeventiende keer een Scrum Round Table plaats. Het onderwerp dit keer is “Hoe pas je “Scaling Scrum” toe in een organisatie.”. Wanneer een organisatie begint met Agile werken en Scrum dan zijn dit over het algemeen eerst losse teams. Deze teams zijn meestal gebaseerd op de huidige organisatiestructuur, je komt dan teams tegen die “.Net en SQL” doen, of “Cobol”, of BI. Maar wat als er een moment komt dat je meerdere teams wilt laten werken aan één oplossing? Hoe doe je dit het beste? Ga je de bestaande teams verdubbelen? Of ga je een logische indeling kiezen?

Tijdens de Scrum Round Table willen we graag met de deelnemers hierover in discussie gaan. Zoals gebruikelijk doen we dit aan de hand van een klein stukje achtergrond en een game gevolgd door discussie. We sluiten af met een borrel.

Spreekt het onderwerp je aan? Vind je het leuk om actief mee te doen en kennis en ervaring in te brengen? Meld je dan aan en help ons om dit tot een succesvolle sessie te maken.

Kijk voor het programma op https://www.delta-n.nl/scrumroundtable
results.name: Scrum Round Table - Scaling Scrum

results.description:
We are proud to announce we are taking part in this year's Border Sessions festival!
Border Sessions is a yearly tech culture festival on a mission to kick-start and fuel challenging ideas, experiments, and endeavors with a strong focus on multidisciplinary projects. We unite creative and critical minds from around the globe who share the belief that technology should be a powerful instrument for positive change.

More info about the whole festival: https://www.bordersessions.org/

Tickets:

4-day wristband - 64,10 €

One day wristband - 27,41 €

Students 4-day wristband - 32,65 €

Students one-day wristband - 11,68 €

Link to purchase tickets:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/border-sessions-festival-2018-tickets-40776417362

After you purchase your ticket, you need to register for our Lab here:
https://www.bordersessions.org/lab/artificial-intelligence-for-public-space-lab/

Location: The Innovation Playground @ The Hague University of Applied Sciences
Johanna Westerdijkplein 75, 2521 EN, Den Haag

What is our Lab gonna be about?

Public space is getting crowded. Millions of artificial agents are joining the interaction. We can sit and discuss threats and uncertainties for hours, and we should. But not in this lab. At least not after the thoughtful introductions by our keynote speakers who will join us in this lab.

This is a straightforward day for AI practitioners to create and test concepts that improve public spaces around us. How can we use AI to improve our physical surroundings? How do we use it in our public lives? Which autonomous agents should join the interaction? Talking flower beds? Self-cleaning city air? Propagating squares for improved civic debate?

AI lovers and friends of a healthy public space, join this lab. Bots are welcome too!

In this lab, we will collaborate in hands-on experiments and do provocative research: we design a prototype for an AI agent that acts in public spaces and investigate how citizens react to this. The goal is to explore its usefulness and acceptability in society - and to figure out at what point this AI agent crosses the border...
Central Questions for this lab are:
1. What are useful dialogues with AI in public spaces?
2. What form can such dialogues take?
3. How are they experienced by people?
4. What factors determine how far AI can go in public dialogues?

The preliminary program of the AI in Public Spaces lab @ Border Sessions:

10:00 Welcome & introduction

10:15 Keynote by Ed Keller, director at the Center for Transformative Media

11:00 Provocative research on AI for Public Spaces, Demo & discussion

11:30 Work session in teams: Creating an AI dialogue in public spaces

12:15 Lunch break

13:15 Work session in teams: Testing the AI dialogue

14:00 Plenary exchange of experiences

14:15 Keynote by a speaker to be confirmed

14:45 Tea break

15:00 Breakout sessions:

- Hands-on AI technology

- Opportunities for AI in public spaces

- Ethics of AI in public spaces

17:00 Closure & drinks

results.description:
Op zaterdag 16 juni 2018 vindt de eerste Hackathon van de MixUG plaats. Deze hackathon staat in het kader van Mixed Reality en HoloLens. Het doel van deze hackathon is om gezamenlijk een MR Room Experience te bouwen. De groep wordt verdeeld in teams van 2 tot 3 personen die elk een puzzelstuk voor de MR Room Experience bedenken en bouwen. Met het oog op Mixed Reality is het natuurlijk gaaf wanneer dit gebruik maakt van de omgeving. Maar je mag geheel zelf bedenken hoe je het wil doen en wat je ervoor wil gebruiken.

Meld je nu aan!!

Wat wordt er van je verwacht

1) Enige ervaring in programmeren in Unity voor HoloLens kan wel handig zijn
2) Een HoloLens device per team. Mocht je geen team hebben, geen zorgen! Er zijn al mensen aangemeld die een HoloLens bezitten. En we leveren zelf ook twee devices voor het evenement

Hoe ziet de dag eruit?

Het gaat erg gezellig worden! De dag ziet er als volgt uit

8u tot 9u Binnenkomst
9u tot 9u30 Voorstellen, uitleg en start van de Hackathon
9u30 tot 10u Bedenken van het puzzelstuk
10u tot 18u Bouwen, eten en fun!
18u tot 19u Tonen van de puzzels en prijsuitreiking onder het genot van pizza of iets anders

Lunch en het avondeten wordt volledig verzorgt. Mochten er dieetwensen zijn, laat ons dat dan even weten.

Waar moet je zijn?

De hackathon vindt plaats bij een van onze sponsoren ETTU. Het adres is Kampenringweg 45b, 2803 PE te Gouda.

Je kunt binnen de poort in de parkeergarage parkeren. Via de garage kun je met de lift naar de vijfde verdieping. Daar zul je ontvangen worden.

results.description:
Aanstaande woensdag 20 juni is het eindelijk zover: de Eonics Open Hack Night Pt. 11! We zullen deze avond kennismaken met de makers van HyperDev die ons alles gaan vertellen over dit nieuwe CI/CD platform dat al bij meerdere Eonics projecten met succes wordt ingezet.

HyperDev is gebouwd dóór en vóór developers & testers. Het platform biedt alles wat je nodig hebt voor moderne softwareontwikkeling volgens de DevOps werkwijze. Je kunt het zien als een kant en klare ontwikkelstraat die je volledig naar eigen wens kunt inrichten en aanpassen, zonder kostbare tijd te verspillen aan beheer en infrastructuur. HyperDev is gebouwd op Docker Swarm. Het HyperDev dashboard en de bijbehorende API ontsluiten alle functionaliteiten voor de ontwikkelaars. Daarnaast is het heel eenvoudig om met een druk op de knop (of een simpele API call) volledige omgevingen te starten en te stoppen. Op deze manier kunnen ook testers en andere stakeholders eenvoudig gebruikmaken van de voordelen van HyperDev. Omdat alles binnen HyperDev dockerized en geversioneerd is, kunnen er op ieder moment een willekeurig aantal gescheiden omgevingen en applicaties worden gestart, zonder dat deze elkaar beïnvloeden zoals in een klassieke ontwikkel- of testomgeving vaak het geval is.

Meer informatie:

- http://hyperdev.io
- https://eonics.nl/inbox/open-hack-night-pt-11-ci-cd-met-hyperdev
results.name: HyperDev: Cloud based docker platform

Please join us to discuss the keys to an effective control system security program with MILLE GANDELSMAN of Indegy, KARL PERMAN of KPMG, BOB BEVIS of Verve Industrial Protection, and ERNEST WOHNIG of System 1.

June 28, 2018 at 10:00 am Eastern US Time

* * REGISTER NOW * * at https://www.cs2ai.org/virtual-meeting-series/

(Also for recorded sessions!)

2 CPE Credits available for attendees

The discussion leaders will each deliver 5-10 minutes of prepared content and then YOU, the audience, will ask questions to help guide the panel discussion! Which means that you will be able to actively participate in the live discussion!

ABSTRACT:
This session will identify the key areas that enable organizations to run effective control systems security programs. Core to this will be understanding how prioritization is accomplished in situations where most of us do not and may never have enough resources.

This session will introduce key elements including but not limited to budgets, governance, policy, assessments, incident response, change management and overall risk management techniques, with a deeper look at some of these same areas in forthcoming sessions.

DISCUSSION LEADER: MILLE GANDELSMAN
Mille leads Indegy’s technology research and product management activities. Prior to Indegy, Mille led engineering efforts for Stratoscale and spent several years leading cyber security research for Israel’s elite intelligence corps. Mille is a graduate of the elite Talpiot military academy and holds a Masters degree with honors in Computer Science from Tel Aviv University.

DISCUSSION LEADER: ERNEST WOHNIG
Ernest is an internationally recognized cyber security and assurance leader having written, presented, and advised senior corporate and federal leadership on security and assurance issues across the energy sector and to the federal government for over 20 years. He has advised clients across several industries, helping them understand their risk posture and to develop proactive security strategies and programs resulting in clear alignment of security investments to business value. Mr. Wohnig is one of the key figures shaping the discussion and practice of cyber security in the critical infrastructure and industrial control system arenas.

DISCUSSION LEADER: ROBERT BEVIS
Bob is the founder of Verve Industrial and leads the technical vision for the company. With over 25 years of cyber security, ICS system design, and project management, Bob’s unique ability to understand cyber security requirements (including NERC-CIP) in an operating environment enable scalable, cost effective and efficient security solutions.

DISCUSSION LEADER: KARL PERMAN
Karl is the Operational Technology Security Lead in KPMG’s Risk Consulting practice with over 30 years of experience delivering critical infrastructure, business protection, compliance, risk management and law enforcement consulting services. He has developed and implemented critical infrastructure protection programs, developed security technology infrastructure to protect assets, created vulnerability assessments in diverse environments, established organizational strategies and value-added security programs, and led high-level, complex investigations of criminal conduct and employee misconduct. His career includes senior level positions including Director of Security, North American Transmission Forum; Manager, Infrastructure Protection and Regulatory Compliance at Exelon Corporation; and Manager, Corporate Investigative and Protective Services at Southern California Edison.

results.description:
Organisaties worden van oudsher opgebouwd om te presteren, voor routinematig werk is dat decennialang een top model. Controles werden ingebouwd voor hogere kwaliteit, processen voor standaardisatie, stafafdelingen om efficiënter te werken. Maar dat alles zorgt juist voor belemmering van de creativiteit en autonomie van kenniswerkers en creatievelingen.

Edwin van der Geest is afgelopen 2 jaar als Managing Director verantwoordelijk geweest voor de Rotterdamse vestiging van Incentro. In die rol heeft hij de vestiging begeleid naar een volledig zelfsturende organisatie. Edwin heeft in zijn missie een bedrijf gestart om organisaties te helpen potentiële energie te ontlokken. Hij vertelt hoe Organisatie Design helpt een nieuwe blik op je organisatie te zetten en deze opnieuw in te richten, om meer waarde uit mensen, teams en organisaties te halen. Edwin vertelt ook over zijn ervaring bij Incentro en de besluitvorming technieken die zij gebruiken.

Naast een lightning talk van Edwin van der Geest over Organisatie Design gaan we ook hands-on aan de slag met Lightning decision jam.

Programma
17:00 inloop, pizza en bier
17:30 presentatie van Edwin van der Geest over Organisatie Design
18:00 lightning decision jam oefenen in teams
19:00 borrel

Shader ontwikkeling voor HoloLens

Unicorns & shaders zijn voor veel ontwikkelaars magische begrippen. In deze sessie zullen we een deel van deze magie gaan ontmaskeren. We gaan stap-voor-stap shaders bouwen die geschikt zijn voor gebruik op de HoloLens.

Level:[masked] – Intermediate
Type: Development
Spreker: Roland Smeenk

19u45 – 20u00 - Pauze

20u00 – 21u00
Ahh screw it... Let's use depth sensors and VR/AR equipment in production

The main vibe of this talk will be inspirational by showing real world examples of using low cost hardware in 3D animation, visual effects, VR and game production.

In the first half we’ll explore the use of consumer depth sensors (like Kinect, Orbbec & RealSense).
Topics include pointlouds (volumetric video) and motion capture.

In the second half we’ll look at recording Vive/Rift tracking data and see how it compares to some higher end motion capture equipment.
As well as how a HoloLens can be used on a highend mocap shoot to help visualize realtime 3D characters on set.

Oh and there may be some 80s & 90s animated gifs 🙂

Type: Inspirational
Spreker: Jasper Brekelmans

21u00 – 21u30 - Borrel

results.description:
Artificial Intelligence has the potential to transform the world we live in, within a decade. Every career and every industry will soon be influenced by AI. Machines equipped with artificial intelligence are becoming steadily more capable of complex tasks, and displaying higher levels of perception, intuition, and intelligence.

This raises questions of philosophical and ethical import. How will artificial intelligence influence the legal and judicial landscape, in an era where machines can analyse forensic evidence, comprehend legal documents, and even generate verdicts? What questions of ethics are raised when autonomous machines can give diagnoses, conduct medical tests, and perform surgeries? How much autonomy do we give intelligent machines, and who do we blame when they make mistakes?

As a specific example, we will see how AI and technology, in general, shape the legal industry and what opportunities arise for legal corporations and professionals interested in the legal industry.

Come to The Hague Tech on the 16th of July, where our two speakers will bring you abreast of the latest technological advancements and opportunities in the legal field, address your questions, and perhaps raise some more questions for you to think about!

The speakers:
Georgios Stathis (1995) is a Ph.D. Candidate on Computational Law and Data Science and Research Assistant at the Introduction of the Data Protection Reform to the Judicial System (INFORM) project of eLaw Center at Leiden University.
He studied Global Law (LL.B.) at Tilburg University (2016) and International and European Trade and Investment Law (LL.M.) at the University of Amsterdam (UvA) (2017).
For more information: https://www.linkedin.com/in/georgios-stathis-75586010b/

Olya (Olga) Kudina is a PhD candidate at the Philosophy Department of the University of Twente. She is interested in the empirically-oriented philosophy and ethics of technology. She works on a project “Mediated Morality: Google Glass, Sex Selection, and the complex interactions between ethics and technology.” Her research investigates how human norms and values are co-shaped by technologies around us. Olga’s research interests are related to ethics, postphenomenology, meaning-making, technomoral change, new and emerging technologies, privacy and surveillance.
For more information: https://www.linkedin.com/in/olyakudina/

Agenda:
18:00 - Doors Open
18:30 - First talk + Q&A
19:10 - Break
19:30 - Second talk + Q&A
20:10- Networking drinks
results.name: Ethical and Legal implications of Artificial Intelligence

Ai Lab would like to invite you to a special presentation, co-organized by the World Startup Factory, where we are going to dive into the exponential technologies which are currently emerging.

Who is this event for?

Technology enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, business people, and visionaries who want to hear some ideas on how Exponential technology is affecting everyday life and business.

About the Speaker

Bobby Bahov is a tech entrepreneur with a huge passion for innovation. His background is in software development but in recent years he’s been focusing completely on business development and community building. He is the founder of Eastsource – a software outsourcing agency working with developers from a dozen countries in Europe. He is also organizing various communities focusing on exponential technology like Ai, Blockchain, and Space. Normally you can find him working on a new business idea and talking passionately about new technologies. Finally, he is one of the founders of Space Mining Technologies - a startup working on a system for resource utilization on the Moon.

Join us for a presentation and discussion on:
- How is Artificial intelligence influencing our lives and how much exactly can we automate?
- How is Blockchain changing industries and where are we going with it?
- How can Space technology be used for Earth applications?
- How is the Internet of Things changing the way we live in our cities?
- Is Quantum Computing going to change everything?

The event is co-organized by The Hague Tech, World Startup Factory, Ai Lab Den Haag, and Blockbar.

results.description:
Program:

18:00 Doors open and food
19:00 We start the talk.
21:00 Official end

Speaker: Wilder Rodrigues

Wilder Rodrigues is a Machine Learning Engineer, a City.AI Ambassador, an IBM Watson AI XPRIZE Contestant and Committer and PMC member of the Apache Software Foundation. He was a guest attendee at AI for Good Global Summit at the United Nations. Wilder now works at Quby, where he and his colleagues focus on developing models to give insight on energy and gas efficiency for the Toon Smart Thermostat.

During my journey on the way to become a Machine Learning Engineer after 20 years working with traditional Software Development, I came up with an idea to reduce the impact caused by the Dying Rectified Linear Unit (a.k.a Dying ReLU) issue on Neural Networks and improve accuracy, The new Rectified Linear Unit with Sinusoidal Curve (a.k.a. SineReLU) does not flattens out negative weights to zero, but instead, it combines them with an extra function and an extra hyper-parameter, then enabling differentiability at any point of the function.

This approach is also superior to the Leaky-ReLU implementation due to the oscillations that it adds to negative weights. So, instead of linearly moving down the bottom-left quadrant based on the Leaky-ReLU alpha parameter, it uses the difference between the sine and cosine functions to create a wave. The amplitude of this wave depends on the hyper-parameter ε.

With this approach, problems like vanishing or exploring gradients, introduced by sigmoid and tanh functions, and the dying ReLU, are mitigated.

This talk will cover the Path; the Inspiration; and the Accomplishments after one hard year of studies.
results.name: An evening about Machine Learning

results.description:
We will have another Vierde vrijdag this month! Summer edition.

Vierde vrijdag is a day for coworking, networking, sharing ideas & showing projects.

Starting at 10 there's coffee, a good time to meet everyone. Feel free to work in projects, chat with each other, get feedback.

From 3.30pm there're presentations / it's possible to present your project. If you have something you'd like to show, mention it in the comments!

This Vierde vrijdag takes place at The Hague Tech, the tech hub just behind The Hague Central Station. It's possible to lunch here for only 5 EUR, +- 1pm.

You can reach The Hague Tech easily by bike, train, metro, bus, and tram. (If you are by car, there is paid street parking in the area till 14:00.)

RSVP & keep updated of confirmed talks.

PROGRAM
==========

☕ COFFEE
10:00 Be welcome to meet & (co)work, have an informal gathering, create your mini-hackathon...

🍟 LUNCH
13:00 Bring your own, visit a bar or have some salad/bread/fries at The Hague Tech for 5 EUR only.

📢 TALKS/SESSIONS
15:30 Announcements & start of program.

--15:45-- Google Design Sprints: how do they work?

Jeroen Walta & Thomas Platzer recently hosted a very interesting Google Design Sprint right here in THT. Learn all about the process from one of the sprintmasters himself.

The design sprint session is followed by a show & tell of the result of last design sprint, by @Diesmaster.

--16:20-- Permanent Future Lab to The Hague?

@bartwr will share the concept of Permanent Future Lab and do a brainstorm: Would The Hague Tech be a good location for #PFLab in The Hague? https://permanentfuturelab.wiki/

--16:45-- The latest AI developments in the July AI Update

Get the latest updates on AI developments, by Ahmed Rbaibi. In just 20 minutes he will show you the most exciting AI moments of this month.

--17:15-- Introducing Telos. The fast, scalable & fair EOS alternative

Keten.io, the team behind DutchEOS, will present their optimised EOS alternative called Telos. Jan Smit & Joost Voordouw can tell you all on how to get started on Telos & why that is a good idea. https://www.telosfoundation.io

📣 TAKE THE STAGE
Want to show/share/tell a bit about your projects/ideas&knowledge? Your innovative business? A fun project? Please let us know in the comments below!

🍻 DRINKS
+- 17:00 Get to know the people even more, start new projects together, drink on failures and success. Drinks can be payed in both crypto, cash & e-EUR.

--

Vierde vrijdag is a monthly recurring meetup. See https://www.meetup.com/vierdevrijdag/events/past/ and https://twitter.com/search?q=%23vierdevrijdag to get an impression of previous events.

Fill in this form if you want to share a talk/workshop/learning during this Vierde vrijdag -> https://goo.gl/forms/Udk0A6zxZbFgKAqn1

Don't miss this.
results.how_to_find_us: Find "The Hague Tech" on Maps, ring the bell for "Blockbar" and go to the 3rd floor. Then left.
results.name: Vierde vrijdag! Sharing knowledge + tech + projects + business + learnings

Come be a part of the Salesforce Saturday/Trailhead meetup in Den Haag! This meetup is for anyone interested in learning all things Salesforce via Trailhead. It doesn't matter if you are a newbie or a seasoned veteran, we are here to have fun and learn at the same time. We will start at approximately 10:00, but we get it if your not a morning person. Feel free to come and go whenever you want.

Don't forget your laptop!

Please free to share this meetup with your colleagues and/or friends.

results.name: Den Haag Salesforce Meetup/Trailhead Saturday

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza, sponsored by our friends from Sentia this time!

The first talk:
Speaker: Serkan Capkan
Title: AWS Deployment Tools - Advantages, Disdvantages and a use case story.
Description: On this session, we'll talk about AWS Deployment tools such as CodePipeline, CodeCommit, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy. Although the motivation is to make it interactive, the plan is to walk through all this products one by one, discuss about features and at the end explain a use case we've implemented at a multi-account environment.

The second talk:
Speaker: Walter Heck
Title: 2FA in AWS
Description: 2FA should be the standard in this day and age, but unfortunately it's not. We'll walk through an overview of the AWS CLI, terraform and serverless and look at how they (don't) support 2FA out of the box but you can still use it.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.
results.how_to_find_us: Go into the main entrance of the WTC building, take the escalators to the 20th floor in Tower E. We're the office in the corner.

results.description:
Vierde vrijdag is a day for coworking, networking, sharing ideas & showing projects. In the afternoon there're talks for and by the community.

WHAT TO EXPECT
=================

Starting at 10:30 there's coffee, a good time to meet everyone. Feel free to work on projects, chat with each other, get feedback.

From 3:30pm there're presentations & it's possible to present your project.

This Vierde vrijdag takes place at The Hague Tech, the tech hub just behind The Hague Central Station. It's possible to lunch here for only 5 EUR, +- 1pm.

HOW TO GET THERE
===================

You can reach The Hague Tech easily by bike, train, metro, bus, and tram. (If you are by car, there is paid street parking in the area till 14:00.)

For a walking route from Central Station to The Hague Tech, see the last image in de 'images carousel' of this page.

PROGRAM
==========

☕ COFFEE
10:00 Be welcome to meet & (co)work, have an informal gathering, create your mini-hackathon..

🍟 LUNCH
12:30 Bring your own, visit a bar or have some salad/bread/fries at The Hague Tech for only 5 EUR.

📢 TALKS/SESSIONS (parallel)

15:30 Start of program: Do you have something to share?

🔸 3 Minute Shoutouts: Share your session topic / thoughts / project / request in less than 3 minutes.

15:45 Studiate - A company introduction by Andrew Wright

Studiate is a platform designed to help music teachers and other independent teachers (ánd member at The Hague Tech). It automates workflow for administration (scheduling, invoicing, payments, bookkeeping, taxes) saving both time and money.

In this session Andrew gives a short introduction on Studiate, shows an impression of the platform as well as a forecast of where Studiate is heading. After the short 5 minute talk there's time for Q&A.

16:00 Exciting times in blockchain world

These days a lot is happening in blockchain space. New chains, consensus mechanisms, scalability techniques, and most of all: crypto starts to be integrated in apps! In this session you'll get a broad overview of the blockchain developments in the latest few weeks.

16:45 Daan Meily shares its research on succesful coworking spaces

How can coworking spaces and start-ups benefit from more collaboration and grow sustainably: After spending several months on researching coworking spaces and using The Hague Tech as a case study, Daan Meily is now eager to share his results. His research was focussed on collaboration and in his pitch he hopes to explain to you a bit better why this is so important.

17:15 Profit first! A session on the theme 'money management'

Bart R just learned about a technique to save and accumulate money, called 'Profit First'. The concept is simple: Always take profit first, then pay your bills. If you can't pay your bills you're overspending. The goal of this session is to exchange ideas on how to manage and accumulate money. What techniques do you use, what works well, what doesn't? Join to share some experiences on this together.

🍻 DRINKS

+- 17:45 Get to know the people even more, start new projects together, drink on failures and success. Drinks can be payed in both crypto, cash & e-EUR.

--

Vierde vrijdag is a monthly recurring meetup. See https://www.meetup.com/vierdevrijdag/events/past/ and https://twitter.com/search?q=%23vierdevrijdag to get an impression of previous events.
results.how_to_find_us: Find "The Hague Tech" on Maps, ring the bell for "Blockbar" and go to the 3rd floor. Then left.
results.name: Vierde vrijdag! Sharing knowledge + tech + learnings + business + projects

results.description:
Wat we gaan doen
Voor meeste marketing- en communicatie afdelingen zijn online campagnes dagelijks werk. Veelal zijn dat uitgaande campagnes met veel push marketing. Al zijn er al flink wat merken bezig met inbound marketing. Met inbound- of content marketing wordt meer gekeken naar de echte informatie behoefte van klanten. Zo is het mogelijk om klanten voor je product of dienst te enthousiasmeren op een moment dat de klant de meeste behoefte heeft aan je product of dienst. En dat zonder ‘koop mij’ te roepen. De verkoop verloopt zo veel natuurlijker.

Vaak ontbreekt nu nog de samenhang bij content marketing; wat doen we wel en wat doen we niet? Welke thema’s kiezen we? En hoe zorgen we voor een goed geïntegreerde content marketing flow? Dat gaat veel verder dan bijvoorbeeld het social media beleid van een merk.

Roeland de Bruin heeft als interim manager de marketing- en communicatie afdelingen geleid van onder andere Triodos Bank, Wereld Natuurfonds, Cito, Electrabel en Eneco. In veel van die rollen heeft hij content marketing en inbound marketing een meer prominente rol gegeven. Hij zal vertellen over zijn ervaringen op dat gebied. Daarbij laat hij zien hoe je met de principes van de design sprint een samenhangend en effectief content marketing beleid kunt opzetten.

Naast de presentatie van Roeland de Bruin gaan we ook hands-on aan de slag en kijken we hoe we zelf een content marketing plan op kunnen zetten.

Programma
17:00 inloop, pizza en bier
17:30 presentatie van Roeland de Bruin over een Content Design Sprint
18:00 Cool Content Design Sprint oefenen in teams
19:00 borrel

Met behulp van de principes van design sprints kun je een goed uitgangspunt opzetten.
results.how_to_find_us: We zitten in de ronde toren bij het oude Haagse vliegveld Ypenburg ✈️
results.name: Hoe kun je technieken uit de design sprint toepassen op jouw content marketing?

results.description:
Op donderdag 30 augustus geven Marius van Eck en Sam Smulders een hands-on sessie over Machine learning, “Wat is machine learning en hoe kan ik dit toepassen in oplossingen?” Na een introductie over machine learning gaan we verschillende machine learning algorithmes en paradigmes doormiddel van opdrachten behandelen. Aan bod komen reinforcement, supervised en unsupervised learning aan bod.

Vereiste voorkennis: Python

17:30 uur Ontvangst
18:00 uur Warme maaltijd
19:00 uur Hands-on Machine Learning
21:00 uur Drinks

De avond vindt plaats bij Quintor Den Haag. Aan deze sessie zijn geen kosten verbonden.

Meer weten? Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Lisanne van Dam (Quintor) via 070-[masked]
results.name: StaQ night - Hands-on Machine learning - Quintor Den Haag

results.description:
Hello everyone,

Exciting times and really about time that I got the ball rolling and organised the first Intelligence and Analysis Professionals Meetup. I've managed to get the support of the Hague Tech, which will be a great location [www.thehaguetech.nl] as there are a lot of other very interesting things going on there.

The time I have set is between 19:00 and 21:00 so as to allow for travel after work and the date [Thursday 30 August] allows us to get the first Meetup organised as soon as possible after the main summer holidays.

At the moment I am hoping, we start with some introductions followed by two 30 minute presentations with discussions. Possible topics are:

- Cyber issues in Intelligence and Analysis
- Introduction to non-standard data types [IoT, Cyber, Network]
- Ergonomics of Intelligence Analysis [soft skills and leadership]
- Open Source Intelligence [OSINT]

Please send me your views [I want to include everyone on this community and also the time slot [there is a possibility to organise this Meetup for the same day between 17:00 and 19:00].

I'll add to this post closer to the time of the Meetup.

Looking forward to meeting you, so please sign up!

Best wishes,

Ammi
results.how_to_find_us: We have chosen this location as it is very central [5 minute walk from Central Station]. Hopefully will enable the porfessionals in nearby cities to attend. The Hague Tech also has a relaxed atmosphere and I'll try to organise drinks and bites.
results.name: Time to organise the first IAP Meetup! Let's get this thing going..

This week Blockbar starts with coffee & 2 sessions:

1. Crypto Algo Trading without code
2. Demo: How to create your own blockchain + coin using Komodo

Next to that there's the normal schedule:

10:00 Walk in, meet people, ask questions

11:00 Mini talks / workshops, max. 30m each

12:30 Lunch

13:00 (Co)work on your projects

Do you work on a blockchain/distributed/crypto project? Join Blockbar, the blockchain cowork space in The Hague :)

Blockbar is a fysical space in The Hague where you can work on your blockchain project, meet people in the scene, discuss latest developments & build your business.

Be welcome to join at Blockbar at The Hague Tech. Every Friday, from 10am.

[SESSIONS:INFO]

11:00 Crypto Algo Trading without code

Create, backtest and deploy your crypto trading strategies without writing code. Mudrex is an intuitive, turing complete visual strategy editor. High performace, horizontally scalable trade execution engine. Mudrex also supports a strategy market to Pick top performing strategies shared by the best traders on the platform to invest and earn from them.

Get beta access to the Mudrex platform and start playing around with strategies.

Greg D'Souza
Managing Partner - bl0xchain

11:30 Demo: This is how you create your own blockchain

It's fairly easy to create an own blockchain & coin using the Komodo command line. The CryptoCash team recently launched their CoinCollect blockchain for their CC coin. With this experience fresh in mind, you will get the opportunity to see how coin creation works and what you need. And you can ask questions right away.

[WHAT TO BRING]

Hierbij nodigen we je uit voor het grootste, gratis*, maandelijkse inspiratie- en netwerkevent van Nederland speciaal voor ZZP'ers en MKB'ers.

Met de zomervakantie achter de rug gaan we weer hard aan het werk. Maar een bezoek aan OC070 geeft jou een nieuwe boost. Want elke maand voorzien we elkaar van kansen, contacten, inspiratie en een goed gesprek.

Programma:

• 9:00 deur open
• 9:30 half uurtje inspiratie: thema "Ervaar VR en AR", meer over deze interactieve en unieke ervaring binnenkort op onze website: https://www.oc070.nl/ - en ook via https://www.facebook.com/oc070
• 10:00 vervolg ontmoetingen met collega ondernemers
• 11:00 aan het werk of nog even blijven hangen / samen lunchen

Met oog op de organisatie en afspraken met Bink Rooftop het verzoek je snel aan te melden.

We kijken er naar uit om elkaar weer te zien en te spreken,

Onno, Arne, Jennifer, Karen, Meggie en Linda

* de toegang en het parkeren zijn gratis, koffie/thee voor eigen rekening

results.description:
Are you a 3D Printing enthusiast or do you want to learn about 3D Printing? Then this meetup is for you.

This meetup is about realizing your and each others' 3D Printing projects. Join others in their project or initiate your own.

The set-up is like a Cafe, do not expect a ready-made course or workshop, but instead people mixing and helping out each other.

Please bring your own laptop, if you have one. The number of PCs at the FabLab is limited.

Peter will unbox and try to assemble his just received 3D (Creality Ender 3) printer from China. It is a very affordable DIY kit which should be relatively easy to assemble.
Do you consider to buy a similar DIY kit; then this can be a good opportunity to see whether this is something for you too....
results.name: 3D Cafe
