Come and join the team behind Sketch, at our next Meetup in the Hague.

We’ll be meeting in the beautiful and historic 'Red Elephant' (Spaces) in the heart of The Hague to eat, drink and talk shop with the local design community.

Bohemian Coding founder Pieter Omvlee will be sharing some insights about the team behind Sketch and, of course, a sneak peek of some upcoming features.

We’re also hosting a full-day workshop, run by Nomadic Designers and Design Tools Network, the following day, where you’ll learn how to create a maintainable design system from scratch, and how to use plugins and shortcuts to speed up your workflow in Sketch. To book your spot in the workshop, visit: https://ti.to/design-tools-network/the-hague-workshop/en

We're excited to meet the creative community in The Hague. See you there!

results.description:
Sealife Scheveningen
Datum: Dinsdag 11 september na college (13:45)
Online-Ticket: €14,75
Groepsonline-ticket (vanaf 10 personen): €11
Korting ING-rentepunten: €7,50

Sealife is een groot zeeaquarium is Scheveningen. Er is gekozen voor Sealife omdat de doelgroep de mogelijk krijgt om een jaarabonnement af te sluiten. De experience die Sealife ons hoopt te geven is de ervaring tussen de bijzondere vissen en interactieve elementen in aquariums. Wij willen geïnspireerd raken door deze bijzondere experience die een betekenisvolle beleving gaat creëren. Hier komt ook het verlengen van een abonnement bij kijken wat erg past bij ons project; Ben verlengen. Hoe speelt Sealife in op de bezoekers? Kom er nu achter en ga met ons mee! :)

Het Belasting & Douane Museum is een museum in Rotterdam. In het museum kan men leren hoe het er vroeger en in het heden bij de douane en de Belastingdienst aan toe ging. Onder meer wordt er verteld hoe spullen werden gesmokkeld

Laat je inspireren door de te zien hoe gevangenen 'problemen' op geniale/originele manier oplossen.

Dit kunnen wij UX/UI Designers gebruiken voor de problemen die wij ondervinden. "Think out of the box"

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

The first talk:
Speaker: Choon Ming Goh (OlinData)
Title: Reducing your AWS bills using Cloud Custodian
Description: Often enough we spawn up new resources in AWS but we either neglect the fact our bills grow bigger as our environments evolve or we do not enforce the clean up of AWS resource often enough. We can take measures to reduce our bills by changing instance size etc but there are more ways to go about it. This talk focuses on how teams can leverage the use of cloud custodian policies in order to reduce an ever growing AWS bills.

The second talk:
Speaker: Leon Kortekaas en Johan Steenhoven (Nationale Nederlanden)
Title: The Cloud journey of Nationale Nederlanden
Description: In this talk Leon and Johan will tell the story about their cloud journey, and the lessons learnt. This talk will not only focus on the technical aspect of things, but also the human side of things.

• What to bring:
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know:
We'll have drinks and pizza.

• Schedule:
18:00 - Doors open
18:10 - Food arrives
19:00 - Building doors close (If you're locked out, call the phonenumber that we announce the day before)
results.name: AWS - The Hague

results.description: Op donderdag 20 september vindt voor de achttiende keer de Scrum Round Table plaats. Het onderwerp dit keer is “Het begrijpen van Kanban”. Bijna overal gebruiken we elementen uit Kanban. Denk aan een boodschappenlijstje in het weekend, maar ook het sprint board van een Scrum team. Maar Kanban is meer dan het afstrepen van lijstjes of user stories naar “Done” zetten. Het zorgt ook vanuit het proces al voor continue verbetering. Tijdens de Scrum Round Table willen we graag met de deelnemers hierover in discussie gaan. Zoals gebruikelijk doen we dit aan de hand van een klein stukje achtergrond, een game gevolgd door discussie en afgesloten met een borrel. Spreekt het onderwerp je aan? Vind je het leuk om actief mee te doen en kennis en ervaring in te brengen? Meld je dan aan via de button onderaan de pagina en help ons om dit tot een succesvolle sessie te maken. Kijk voor het programma op https://www.delta-n.nl/scrumroundtable
results.name: Scrum Round Table - Kanban

Wij willen vanuit school direct door naar het Haagse fotomuseum. Wie mee wil is welkom.

De tentoonstelling die we gaan bezoeken heet "Hoe rijk ben je echt?" - die gaat over rijkdom en de cultuur rondom de rijke mensen.

Prijzen:
9,00 per persoon
8,00 per persoon voor groepen (>15 man)

Over het fotomuseum:

"In de huidige beeldcultuur zien we dagelijks een geweldige stroom aan beelden voorbij komen. Beelden die door veel mensen als waarheid worden aangenomen. Maar dat fotografie over waarheid gaat, is een aloude misvatting. Fotografie is een kunstvorm. Het Fotomuseum Den Haag wil een plek zijn waar mensen de ruimte en rust kunnen vinden om de gelaagdheid, betekenissen en context van de fotografie te ontdekken en met aandacht te kunnen kijken; naar de kunst, zichzelf, de omgeving en de wereld."

results.description:
Als je al bekend bent met de Eonics werkwijze weet je dat we graag werken met Docker en HyperDev. Deze tools maken hoge kwaliteit software-ontwikkeling een stuk eenvoudiger voor ontwikkelaars en andere betrokkenen. In deze Open Hack Night zullen we inzoomen op een specifieke onderdeel van dit ontwikkel-proces; browser-based testen met behulp van het TestX framework in een Dockerized omgeving (ook de geautomatiseerde testen draaien in een container). Dit test-framework is gebaseerd op Protractor en integreert uitstekend met Docker en HyperDev. Dit is niet verwonderlijk aangezien het ontwikkeld wordt door HyperDev mede-oprichter Gantcho Kojuharov, die ook aanwezig zal zijn.

Deze Open Hack Night wordt geleid door Vince van Oosten. Vince heeft als DevOps expert bij Eonics al veel met TestX gewerkt, waarbij hij het framework zelfs heeft toegepast buiten het test-domein. Inmiddels heeft hij dan ook diverse patches aangedragen die het framework verder hebben verbeterd en uitgebreid. Na de inleidende presentatie, natuurlijk gevolgd door de traditionele pizza-pauze, gaan we zelf de mouwen opstropen en onder begeleiding kennismaken met de voordelen van deze werkwijze. Kortom: een leerzame avond voor iedere software engineer die veel in een devops context werkt.
results.name: Container based test automation

Ai Lab would like to invite you to a special presentation on what are the possible ways to use artificial intelligence for your business.

Dave Coplin, Microsoft’s chief envisioning officer, said AI is the most important technology that anybody on the planet is working on today, This technology will change how we relate to technology,
It will change how we relate to each other.
I would argue that it will even change how we perceive what it means to be human.”

AI is going to disrupt a lot of industries and change the way we do business. Today you have the unique opportunity to be ahead of the curve and use this technology for your own benefit.

A PwC report estimates that AI will contribute $15.7 trillion to the global economy by 2030.

In this workshop you will learn:

-A solid basis of what artificial intelligence is and how it works
-How AI is applied in industries today
-What the most common pitfalls are when starting an AI project.
-How to create your own AI Strategy

No previous knowledge or technical background is required. The workshop is targeting business executives who want to get ideas on how Ai can help their business.

The price for this event will be €5 to cover food and drinks.
We hope to see you at the workshop.

Gebruikers onderzoek is belangrijk. Daar zijn we het allemaal over eens. Het voorkomt kostbare fouten en bespaart je geld en frustratie.

Maar hoe doe je dat binnen een agile proces?

Wanneer de scrum-trein rijdt lijkt er geen tijd te zijn voor gebruikersonderzoek. Maar dat is schijn. Esther en Matthijs laten je zien dat het tóch mogelijk is!

De vragen die we beantwoorden: hoe kom je aan de juiste deelnemers, welke vragen stel je ze, wat ga je testen en hoe verwerk je de resultaten?
Ook gaan we in op guerrilla testing en remote testing.

Wil je de behoeften van je doelgroep in kaart brengen, zien of je tone-of voice aanslaat, of gewoonweg je website verbeteren?
Dan is deze workshop voor jou!

results.description:
• What we'll do
The evening will start at 18:00, where you can grab a drink and we will enjoy dinner together. On the menu will be soup, a salad, bami with chicken and a dessert. This will give you a chance to share your thoughts with other developers and connect with new people.

At 19:00 the Techtalk will start, Three speakers will talk about three different topics we will announce them later

Carina Semerdzhan will talk about the topic "From nerd to googler"
"Do you want to code as a real google engineer?
Do you want to be a real bearded programmer and an algorithms guru?
Do you have no ideas about Java or C ++?
And still, do not want to break up with javascript?
If you answer yes at least one time, you have not to miss it!
This talk has been prepared in the collaboration with a Google engineer and will cover typical questions of the big companies interviews in the javascript wrap!"

Giovane Moura will talk about Engineering for DDoS attacks: a case study using DNS
"Abstract: Denial-of-service attacks have become cheaper, bigger, and more frequent over the last years. Currently, the biggest known DDoS to date peaked at 1.7 Tb/s. The rise of the so-called IoT botnets means that services are now vulnerable to a massive army sizeable to originate legitimate traffic (no spoofed packets).
In this talk, we will use the DNS system as case study and present the research we have been carrying out over the last years within the SAND project (http://www.sand-project.nl/) to better engineer DNS in the face of rising DDoS attacks, and we show how our recommendations were ultimately deployed at SIDN (.nl operator), as well as others. Even though our case study is DNS, participants can also use some of the recommendations in others services.
Short bio: Giovane C. M. Moura is a Data Scientist with SIDN Labs (the research arm of SIDN) and a Research Guest at The Cyber Security at Delft University of Technology. His research focuses on Internet routing and engineering, as well as security. He holds a PhD from the University of Twente (2013)."

Faris Tangastani will talk about his personal take on starting with a React
"This topic will be about learning something new, specifically React. It will be half talking and sharing my experience and maybe gauging other peoples experiences of how to learn something that may seem daunting. As well as the half workshop where we can have a look at some of the ways you can introduce and learn React to eventually add it to your own personal stack."
results.name: Competa TechTalk September

results.description:
An exciting new Vierde vrijdag this month, featuring virtual reality demos, blockchain talks & info on the development of a new content creators platform. September 28th!

Vierde vrijdag is a day for coworking, networking, sharing ideas & showing projects. In the afternoon there're talks for and by the community.

WHAT TO EXPECT
=================

Starting at 10:00 there's coffee, a good time to meet everyone. Feel free to work on projects, chat with each other, get feedback. From 2pm there're presentations & it's possible to present your project.

This Vierde vrijdag takes place at The Hague Tech, the tech hub just behind The Hague Central Station.

HOW TO GET THERE
===================

You can reach The Hague Tech easily by bike, train, metro, bus, and tram. (If you are by car, there is paid street parking in the area till 14:00.)

For a walking route from Central Station to The Hague Tech, see the last image in de 'images carousel' of this page.

PROGRAM
==========

☕ COFFEE
10:00 Be welcome to meet & (co)work, have an informal gathering, create your mini-hackathon..

🍟 LUNCH
12:30 Have salad/bread/fries at The Hague Tech for only 5 EUR, or bring your own.

📢 TALKS/SESSIONS (parallel)

★ 14:00 Introduction & 2-minute announcements

Have something to share, ask or announce to the community? Do it now! You have three minutes to share what you want to share.

In this intro you'll get to know the cool projects from in and outside the community in no time.

★ 14:15 - 14:45 The Content Blockchain project

The Content Blockchain Project https://content-blockchain.org is an open initiative to support the creation of a dedicated blockchain network designed for the media ecosystem.

The network will simplify digital content identification, license management, content distribution and the monetization of digital content. It is open and can be used by anyone to create innovative applications, enabling new business models on a decentralized network.

The session by Sebastian Posth will introduce the Content Blockchain, the ISCC digital standard identifier http://iscc.codes/ and present the roadmap for the launch of the network.

★ 15:00 - 15:30 Mining cryptocurrencies: This is how it works

Mick (CryptoPepes) will give you a mining demo. You'll learn about Proof of Work & blockchain consensus mechanisms. The people in the audience function as block producers. Join this interactive, informative session to learn about the way blockchain works.

★ 15:45 - 16:15 The state of Virtual Reality by DutchVR

DutchVR http://dutchvr.com/ is a well known The Hague based company specialized in creating VR and AR applications. In this session by Duncan Smit you'll see one of the newer demos. During the day it's possible to experience VR / AR yourself!

★ 16:15 - 16:45 Blockchain Monthly Update

Blockchain Monthly Update / What happened in blockchain this month? The Blockbar community shares the latest news, current crypto projects & insights on blockchain space.

Program to be finalized. Leave a message if you want a time slot for your topic.

🍻 DRINKS

17:00 Get to know the people even more, start new projects together, drink on failures and success. Drinks can be payed in both crypto, cash & e-EUR.

--

Vierde vrijdag group chat on Telegram: https://t.me/joinchat/A8b03hGYC8RkLnEa4_tGeA

We have at FabLab Mariahoeve the disposal of a 100 W laser cutter with a working surface of 100 x 60 cm.

During this workshop you will learn the principles to use a laser cutter.

In the workshop the following topics will be discussed:

• operation of the machine
• controlling the machine via desktop or control panel
• processing of various materials (possibilities and limitations)
• the road from design to product

At the end of the workshop we will construct a small item from plywood or plexiglass.
You will receive a certificate of participation and can use the machine in the future during the FabLab walk-in hours.

The minimum number of participants is 4 and the maximum number is 7 participants.

With less than 4 participants, the workshop will be given on a different day.

The costs of this workshop are Euro 35, -

=====================================

Wij hebben in FabLab Mariahoeve de beschikking over een 100 W lasersnijder met een werkoppervlak van 100 x 60 cm.

Tijdens deze workshop leer je de beginselen om een lasersnijder te gebruiken.

In de workshop komen o.a. de volgende onderwerpen aan de orde:

• werking van de machine
• aansturen van de machine via desktop dan wel bedieningspaneel
• verwerking van diverse materialen (mogelijkheden en beperkingen)
• de weg van ontwerp naar product

Aan het eind van de workshop maken we een klein werkstuk van multiplex of plexiglas.
Je ontvangt een bewijs van deelname en kunt daarmee in de toekomst gebruik maken van de machine tijdens inloopuren van het FabLab.

Het minimum aantal deelnemers is 4 en het maximum aantal is 7 deelnemers.

Bij minder dan 4 deelnemers zal de workshop op een andere dag gegeven worden.

De kosten van deze workshop bedragen Euro 35,-
results.how_to_find_us: Op loopafstand van tramlijn 6 halte Vlamenburg en NS station Mariahoeve.
results.name: Workshop lasercutter

results.description:
Large scale availability of image data, and recent advances in deep neural networks have led to unprecedented advancements in the field of computer vision. Modern day computer vision algorithms are able to identify and classify objects in real time, diagnose skin diseases with higher accuracy than groups of expert doctors, and can recognize people by face, even if they change their hairstyles or facial hair. These phenomenal breakthroughs in deep computer vision have happened within the last decade – imagine what the near future will show us!

AI Lab is proud to present a special two-part event on computer vision. This Monday, you will learn about bleeding edge computer vision technology being applied to two different fields – 3D computer vision, and computer vision for agriculture.

And next week we will have a special 3 hour hands-on workshop where you will learn the fundamentals of deep computer vision, right from the basics of convolutional neural networks, to the state of the art algorithm for object detection and localization, YOLO (You Only Look Once).

Sign up for the second part here: https://www.meetup.com/AI-Lab/events/254880205/

Speaker: Dennis van Muijen, Rijk Zwaan
https://www.linkedin.com/in/dvanmuijen/

"Food security starts with good seeds”

The Netherlands is the 2nd largest exporter of agricultural products and the largest exporter of vegetable seeds with a market share of 40%. Innovation is key in this sector and deep learning is a pivotal catalyst in developing new products. In the talk lessons learnt in providing an end-to-end computer vision application are shared as well as a bright future ahead regarding deep learning in genomics.'

Speaker: Dr. Sezer Karaoglu, CTO at 3DUniversum
https://www.linkedin.com/in/sezer-karaoglu-phd-1650a01a/

How the advances in 3D Computer Vision and Artificial Intelligence change the way we solve problems.

In this talk, we will provide an overview of the rapidly evolving field of 3D computer vision and Artificial Intelligence. In addition, we will interactively demonstrate 3DU solutions (i.e. mobile 3D scanning, virtual eyewear try on, visual inspection, smart video manipulation etc.) and show how artificial intelligence is already changing life paradigms to individuals as well as our whole society.

Agenda:
18:00 - Doors Open
18:30 - First talk + Q&A
19:10 - Break
19:30 - Second talk + Q&A
20:10- Networking drinks
results.name: Computer Vision Industry examples

results.description:
Vierde vrijdag | October 2018 | Talks, networking, sharing knowledge | Line up: OEHU energy project using decentralized storage, Intelectual Property, data storage, blockchain technology, drinks 🍸

For the first time we'll start the talks at 5pm and end with drinks +- 8pm. This way you can work on your projects in daytime and celebrate the end of the week ánd month with people+talks+drinks afterwards. Curious what you think of this schedule, let us know at the meetup!

🎉 LINE UP

(You're welcome at The Hague Tech from 10, if you want to work on own projects and/or meet the community at The Hague Tech. The talks start at 17:00h)

★ 14:30 Blockbar deepdive: Pirate Chain, the most private blockchain

Find out about the privacy challenges of Zcash & Monero and how Pirate Chain came to their answer. Is Pirate Chain the next big privacy coin?

An introduction to privacy aspects of blockchains, crypto conditions and Pirate Chain. ARRR!

★ 17:00 Introduction & 2-minute announcements

Have something to share, ask or announce to the community? Do it now! You have two minutes to share what you want to share.

In this intro you'll get to know the cool projects from in and outside the community in no time.

★ 17:15 - 17:45 Data storage on the blockchain? / bart roorda

Blockchain for data storage? In this talk you'll learn when to use blockchain (and when not). After this session you know how data is stored in blocks. Next to that you'll get a broad overview of live projects that already work on daily basis with data storage + blockchain in their online platforms.

★ 17:45 - 18:15 Intellectual Property Rights 101 / Sil Hu

Sil will give a 30-45 minute presentation on IP rights in regard of technical inventions, i.e. patent and copy rights and trade secrets. After this you will know what intellectual property rights are and what their function is in society. You will know what the scope of the IP rights are and their limitations. You will have a general understanding of the requirements that need to be satisfied to claim protection and you will be able to identify the differences of each IP right.

★ 18:30 - 19:00 Open Energy Hub / OEHU team

This month you can learn about OEHU (a new energy project using the decentralized web).

OEHU makes yóu owner of your energy data. Simple connect OEHU to your smart meter & immediately get access to your personal dashboard. Read about the OEHU project at https://oehu.org/.

In this session the OEHU shows how you can use OEHU for your advantage. Also there will be an Q&A.

★ 19:00 - 19:30 Blockbar / What happened in Blockchain this month?

Join us for an interactive session on the developments in blockchain / crypto space last month. Everyone can bring its list with news, developments, updates on new projects of this month. End result is "The state of blockchain, October 2018". Join if you like to know more about blockchain developments in general.

🍻 DRINKS

19:30 Get to know the people even more, start new projects together, drink on failures and successes.

There will be some food available. We ask for an optional donation that can be paid at the event.

Drinks & food can be payed in both crypto, cash & e-EUR.

--

Vierde vrijdag group chat on Telegram: https://t.me/joinchat/A8b03hGYC8RkLnEa4_tGeA

results.description:
In the second installment of our 2-part event on deep computer vision, we have a hands-on lecture on the fundamentals of deep computer vision. (First part: https://www.meetup.com/AI-Lab/events/254880165/)

We start by introducing the convolutional neural network, the building block of most modern day computer vision algorithms. You will learn how CNNs work and you will build your own image classifier in TensorFlow/Keras. (1,5 hours)

After the break, we will dive into YOLO (You Only Look Once) – the state of the art algorithm used to detect and localize objects in real time. You will understand the important concepts used and will see a demo of YOLO in action. (1,5 hours)

Note that while everyone can follow the lecture as it will be presented in relatively simple language, you will get the most out of the lecture if you can code in Python and are willing to follow along with coding during the lecture. Skeleton code in Python Notebooks will be provided and we will fill in the relevant code together.
results.name: Computer vision hands-on workshop - Classification/Object Localization/Detection

results.description:
Details
17u30 – 18u30 - Binnenkomst
18u00 – 18u30 - Eten
18u30 – 18u45 - Venue

18u45 – 19u45
Een HoloLens Demo geven waar de spetters van af spatten!

Mixed Reality is iets wat je moet ervaren. Het is niet uit te leggen hoe een echte stereoscopische ervaring is zonder het een keer te zien. Ik vergelijk het altijd met uitleggen hoe appeltaart smaakt: je kunt beter een hap nemen dan uren praten over de interactie tussen deeg, appels, kaneel, suiker.....

Dat is allemaal leuk en aardig, maar niet praktisch als je een demo moet geven voor een groep mensen. Zo gauw je al meer dan een paar personen hebt, is het doorgeven van de HoloLens niet meer te doen. Zoals je wel weet, moet de HoloLens voor iedere gebruiker opnieuw ingesteld worden om de IPD goed te zetten. En wie dat doet nu eigenlijk nog?

Gelukkig hebben we Mixed Reality Capture. Je kunt met een browser de gegenereerde hologrammen de beelden van de ingebouwde webcam mixen en delen op een scherm. Dat is een stap in de geode richting, maar niet goed genoeg.

Microsoft heeft dat ook door, en heeft de Spectator View in het leven geroepen. Hiermee krijg je een veel betere ervaring dan via de MRC. Maar... dit is erg lastig in te regelen en om verreist veel kennis en ervaring (en dure apparatuur, zoals een extra HoloLens, een dure camera, capture cards enzovoorts).

Het leek er lange tijd op dat dit problem niet op te lossen was.

Totdat ineens het bericht verscheen dat er een lower-tech oplossing was die dicht in de buurt van de Spectator View oplossing komt. Niet helemaal, maar goed genoeg!

In deze sessie neemt Dennis je mee door deze scenarios en laat je zien hoe je een demo geeft die mensen nog lang zal heugen. En ja: de nieuwe spectator view preview vormt daar de kern van!

Level:[masked]
Type: Functioneel / Development
Spreker: Dennis Vroegop

19u45 – 20u00 - Pauze

20u00 – 21u00
Mixed reality voor first responders en onderzoekers van een plaats delict.

Presentatie en uitleg over onderzoek naar het gebruik van mixed reality studies die het NFI, de politie en de TU delft in de afgelopen jaren hebben uitgevoerd in het CSI experience lab. Tenslotte zal er een korte presentatie worden gegeven van de meest recente ontwikkelingen met de Hololens bij het lectoraat forensische ICT van de hogeschool Leiden

Level: 200
Type: Functioneel
Spreker: Jurrien Bijhold

21u00 – 21u30 - Borrel

Meer informatie en uitgebreide agenda kan worden gevonden op https://www.mixug.com/mixug-evenement-november-2018/
results.name: Mixed Reality User Group Evenement - November 2018

results.description:
This is our very first meetup! So we chose Getting started with Freelancing as a topic.

Freelance The Hague is for freelancers in all fields, from developers to marketeers to designers to project managers. If we team up we can share, learn en improve. And make some new friends :)

The first meetup is about Getting Started. As a freelancer you have to run a business on your own, so this can be quite challenging in the beginning. And if you already run smoothly, maybe you have other goals or some valuable tips.

We will start with a central talk about Getting Started with Freelancing. Then we will partner up and do some exercises. Afterwards you’ll have a chance to mingle.

It will be at the Nomadz coworking space in Bink36. We can use it for free thanks to Erik from Nomadz 😘 (https://www.nomadz.nl)

Update about the starting time:

19:30 Gather and grab a drink
20:00 Start the meetup
21:30 Mingle
22:00 End

•••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••

Lets keep in touch!

Facebook ➣ https://www.facebook.com/freelancethehague/

Instagram ➣ https://www.instagram.com/freelancethehague/

Twitter ➣ https://twitter.com/freelancehague

Come be a part of the Salesforce Saturday/Trailhead meetup in Den Haag! This meetup is for anyone interested in learning all things Salesforce via Trailhead. It doesn't matter if you are a newbie or a seasoned veteran, we are here to have fun and learn at the same time. We will start at approximately 10:00, but we get it if your not a morning person. results.description:
Program

18:00 Doors open and dinner
19:00 We start the talk, after the talk we can have discussion, drink beer
21:00 Official end, doors close

=== Build a Kotlin Webflux App from Scratch in 45 minutes. ===

Watch me live build a webserver from scratch using Kotlin, Spring 5's Webflux, Gradle and MongoDB. This will show that Kotlin is just a syntax upgrade from Java and everything that works for the Java ecosystem works equally well or better with Kotlin. Of course we need to be reactive, so let’s throw in MongoDB and show the functional routing. Maybe we have some time to throw in something extra too.

Speaker: Joost Heijkoop

Passionate software craftsman working for Xebia and organiser at Amsterdam.scala & Kotlin.amsterdam, always looking to learn, help, share, teach and meet new people.
results.name: Kotlin live coding

results.description:
Are you a 3D Printing enthusiast or do you want to learn about 3D Printing? Then this meetup is for you.

This meetup is about realizing your and each others' 3D Printing projects. Join others in their project or initiate your own.

The set-up is like a Cafe, do not expect a ready-made course or workshop, but instead people mixing and helping out each other.

You can bring your own laptop, if you have one. 5 PCs are available at the fablab.

This MeetUp we will:
- try once more to operate our 3D paste printer.
- discuss ongoing projects
- choose a DIY printable draw robot to assemble
- talk about pros and cons of the 'Snapmaker 3-in-1 3D printer'
results.name: 3D Cafe

results.description:
Het belang van DevOps wordt voor organisaties steeds duidelijker. Ook dit jaar is uit het Accelerate: State of DevOps report 2018 van DORA weer gebleken waarom investeren in DevOps belangrijk is. Teams die geen DevOps practices toepassen presteren minder dan de teams die dat wel doen. Ook al is de noodzaak duidelijk. Het is nog steeds lastig om te bepalen waar je het best kunt starten. Hoe wordt je nu een organisatie die excelleert in DevOps? Waar kun je het best beginnen? Hoe zorg je ervoor dat er een cultuur ontstaat die je hierin ondersteunt? En hoe weet je zeker dat je de juiste functionaliteit aan de eindgebruiker aanbiedt? Op donderdag 15 november organiseren wij het Accelerate your DevOps event. Hierin bieden wij u handvatten om uw DevOps te verbeteren en te versnellen.

Naast sessies van onze eigen DevOps Consultants, staan er ook sessies op het programma van Microsoft en de Schiphol Group.

Het maximale aantal van 50 deelnemers is bijna bereikt. Aanmelden is alleen nog mogelijk via https://www.delta-n.nl/evenement/accelerate-your-devops. Hier vind je ook het volledige programma.
results.name: Accelerate your DevOps

Registration is now open for thé Hackathon for Peace, Justice and Security, organized in the Hague which we are co-organizing together with the Data Science Initiative in the Hague. On 17th and 18th of November, teams will use their technical skills to help solve real-world challenges.

We are calling all developers, data scientists, AI and ML experts, business developers, legal professionals and other techies and do-gooders! Make an actual impact with your work ánd compete for great prize money at the same time.

results.description:
• What we'll do
At our AWS Meetup The Hague we'll have two interesting talks and some beer and pizza.

The first talk:
Speaker: Murat Lostar
Title: Securing and assuring the cloud in the post-GDPR (& PCI/DSS, ISO 27001) era.
Summary: How can we design, implement, assess, select, control and audit different cloud types and services in the post PCI/DSS, ISO 27001, GDPR world? How can we integrate our organisational and IT security efforts with our cloud? The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) is specifically designed to provide fundamental security principles to guide cloud vendors and to assist cloud customers in assessing the overall security risk of services. During this talk and discussion, you will gain basic understanding of CSA-CCM and its different usage styles to meet your specific needs.

Murat, a regular keynote speaker on cyber security, has been in information security industry for more than 20 years with an additional previous 10+ years on software development. Besides managing a UK and Turkey based security consultancy company Lostar.com, he has been the founding president of ISACA-Istanbul Chapter and currently leading Cloud Security Alliance Chapter in Turkey.

The second talk:
Speaker: Gérard de Vos
Title: "Shift Left Security", what the funk does that mean?
Summary: In the agile, lean, DevOps communities people talk about improving security by "shifting left". Patterns and tools are emerging, or re-emerging, that make security less of a pain in the development process while also making applications more secure. In this talk, and discussion maybe, we explore what that means and how we can do that.

Gérard is a systems engineer (or devops engineer) and architect who helps businesses deliver value by applying DevOps and Lean principles, Continuous Delivery, and Cloud technologies.
He knows that IT services can be delivered faster, with lower risk and lower costs by applying modern architectures, organizational structures and ways of working made popular through the DevOps movement.

• What to bring
An appetite for learning!

• Important to know
We'll have drinks and pizza.
results.how_to_find_us: Go into the main entrance of the WTC building, take the escalators to the 20th floor in Tower E. We're the office in the corner.

results.description:
An evening dedicated to business & tech: Vierde vrijdag is the monthly meetup where people share knowledge and experience using talks & workshops c.q. a good place to meet&learn.

Every fourth Friday of the month. Tell something about your month, growth, fuckups, best new connections, the book you read recently, insights..

★ 16:30 Walk-in & drinks
It's Friday! From 4.30pm we have some starter drinks, together with the borrel to celebrate a new partnership of THBA, IQ, World Startup Factory and Find Brasil (The Hague/NL - Brasil).

★ 17:00 Welcome & 2 minute announcements (all)
Have something to share, ask or announce to the community? Do it now! You have two minutes to share what you want to share.

The meetup has four time slots:
17:15 - 18:00
18:15 - 19:00
19:15 - 19:45
19:45 - 20:15
Find your talk and feel free to switch in between in case of parallel sessions. Food is available during the full evening.

★ 17:15 Blockchain technology for your business /Susanne Pieterse (beginner)
The presentation will give insight into blockchain applications for business processes. You will learn under which circumstances blockchain technology can innovate your business. | EVENT SPACE

★ 18:15 Intellectual Property 101 /Sil Hu (beginner)
Intellectual Property 101 re technical inventions, part 2. While the first session of October 26 focused on copy rights and trade secrets, we will now look at patents and their relation to other IPRs. What is it and what is it not? What does it take to register patents in Europe? To patent or not to patent?; that is (also) the question. | EVENT SPACE

★ 18:15 The Blockchain Tiramisu - Tech Stacks and Pragmatic Engineering /Liam Zebedee (tech/expert)
Deep dive into blockchain engineering practices, where they stem from, and all different aspects of the stack that you wouldn’t consider at first glance 😛 | LAB SPACE

★ 19:15 The Hague: Vision on a digital city /Yvo (beginner)
Ivo Hunink works with the The Hague municipality on an interesting project: Vision on a digital city and municipality - Join to hear about the current results of the project & share some ideas! | LAB SPACE

★ 19:45 Blockchain Monthly Update (intermediate)
Join us for an interactive session on the developments in blockchain & crypto space last month. Everyone can bring its list with news, developments, updates on new projects of this month. End result is "The state of blockchain, November 2018". Join if you like to know more about blockchain developments in general. | LAB SPACE

🍻 Drinks
Drinks & diner can be payed in both crypto, cash & e-EUR. 1.00 per drink, 5 euros for food. | MAIN SPACE

The program is not final yet. Do you want to be a part of the program by facilitating a session? => https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfOMPfYigJbng2kiBVJn5eEBb4WN2WgcIIxUVP3SBXStrWwIw/viewform

WHAT TO EXPECT
=================

This Vierde vrijdag takes place at The Hague Tech, the tech hub just behind The Hague Central Station.

During the day you are welcome to work and meet at The Hague Tech. From 10am The Hague Tech is open. The https://www.meetup.com/blockbar meetup is there as well during daytime.

At 17:00 we start with presentations.

HOW TO GET THERE
===================

You can reach The Hague Tech easily by bike, train, metro, bus, and tram. (If you are by car, there is paid street parking in the area till 14:00.)

For a walking route from Central Station to The Hague Tech, see the last slider image of this page. Or watch this video for an alternative route: https://youtu.be/YeeMzcAUNk8

--

Vierde vrijdag is a collaboration of the communities of The Hague Tech (https://www.thehaguetech.com/events), Blockbar (https://www.blockbar.nl/), AI Lab (https://www.meetup.com/AI-Lab/) among others.

You're invited to join Vierde vrijdag group chat on Telegram:
https://t.me/joinchat/A8b03hGYC8RkLnEa4_tGeA
results.how_to_find_us: Find "The Hague Tech" on Maps, ring the bell for "Blockbar" and go to the 3rd floor. Then left.
results.name: Vierde vrijdag! Talks, networking & drinks at The Hague Tech hub

results.description:
Please join us for the inaugural meeting of Haaglanden.scala. Our first meetup will take place at Cleverbase, Maanweg 174 Den Haag, which is conveniently located close to NS station Voorburg.

The agenda:

18:00 start with food and drinks

19:00 Willem Vermeer of Cleverbase - "Typed actors - should I start using them?". This talk was also accepted for Scala Exchange London in December 2018

"Typed actors are finally here and for all of you lovers of typesafe programming - just their name is enough to get you excited! But here you are, maintaining a large scala/akka codebase - should you immediately migrate all your actors to typed actors? What will be the benefits and will your code look shinier when you're done? How are you going to sell this internal refactoring to the boss? In this talk, you will discover attempts to step into the world of typed actors. What was the impact, what have you learned, what is still missing and what did you end up with. The talk is aimed for you if you are interested in akka development but have not made the move to typed actors yet but may be wondering what you could be missing."

19:45 break

20:00 Marcel Matthijs of Tradecloud - "How we integrated Apache Kafka into the Tradecloud architecture"

"Apache Kafka looks very attractive at first sight when you are building
available and scalable applications using Akka and Scala. Looking at your
requirements, when do you decide to use Kafka or rather not? How does a
software architecture and infrastructure using Kafka and Akka look like?
What are recommended Scala libraries for using Kafka?

We will quickly explain what Kafka does, introduce use cases of Kakfa, explain the event-driven software architecture and clustered infrastructure used at Tradecloud. We will zoom in on the Alpakka reactive streams Kafka connector (https://github.com/akka/alpakka-kafka) and our Kafka Akka wrapper (https://github.com/tradecloud/akka-kafka) which makes your Kafka life just a bit easier."

20:45 drinks

21:30 the end

The building is being renovated - do not let the decrepit atmosphere of the entrance scare you off. Pass through the glass doors and take a left to the elevators and get out at the 14th floor then take a right and ring the doorbell. For security reasons we will hand out personalised name tags when you enter.

If you plan to come by car: do NOT park in the garage underneath the main building - it closes at 7pm! Instead try to park across the Maanweg - after 17:00 parking is free in this municipal zone.
results.name: Kick-off with presentations on Kafka and Akka Typed Actors

results.description:
Het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van een consistente gebruikerservaring is tegenwoordig helemaal hot. Het aantal devices en platformen dat we als ontwerpers en ontwikkelaars moeten ondersteunen groeit snel. Een manier om hiermee om te gaan is een Design System. Dit is een geraamte waarin alle afspraken staan zoals, accessibility guidelines, styleguides, content richtlijnen, brand richtlijnen, patterns, UI Libraries, CSS frameworks, enzovoorts. Dit opzetten en uitbreiden is alleen vaak makkelijker gezegd dan gedaan.

Tijdens deze Meetup zullen onze inzichten delen van de ‘State of Design Systems’ enquete welke is ingevuld door meer dan 260 Nederlandse designers en developers! Daarnaast delen we onze ervaringen met jullie over hoe je je Design System kunt opzetten, onderhouden en schalen, maar vooral ook wat je moet doen om te voorkomen dat je Design System één groot fiasco wordt!
results.how_to_find_us: We zitten in de ronde toren bij het oude Haagse vliegveld Ypenburg ✈️
results.name: Help, ik heb een Design System. Wat nu?

results.description:
Ons gratis maandelijks inspiratie- en netwerkevent valt in december samen met het feest van Sinterklaas. Daarom geven we in december een leuke alternatieve invulling aan ons evenement speciaal voor ZZP'ers en MKB'ers!

Tijdens de december Editie van OC070 gaan we ° Speednetwerken °, maar wel met een twist. In een sessie van 3-4 minuten ga jij in gesprek met een andere ondernemer. Na deze sessie schuift iedereen door en begin je een nieuw gesprek met een andere ondernemer. Je leert op deze manier in korte tijd en op leuke wijze (onze "twist") vele mede-ondernemers kennen. Na afloop is er nog tijd om te netwerken en bijvoorbeeld een eerder speeddate gesprek in alle rust te vervolgen.

Start het nieuwe jaar 2019 met een groot aantal nieuwe interessante contacten (en mogelijk nieuwe samenwerkingen) en kom naar ons december evenement op 5 december. Speeddaten in rijmvorm is toegestaan! ☺

Programma:

• 9:00 deur open
• 9:30 instructies / tips / iedereen op de goede plaats
• 9:40 start van de gesprekken / speeddates (met twist)
• 10:10 vervolg ontmoetingen met collega ondernemers
• 11:00 aan het werk of nog even blijven hangen / samen lunchen

Met oog op de organisatie en afspraken met Bink Rooftop het verzoek je snel aan te melden.

We kijken er naar uit om met elkaar te speeddaten,

Onno, Jennifer, Karen, Meggie, Linda en Arne

►de toegang en het parkeren zijn gratis, koffie/thee voor eigen rekening
results.how_to_find_us: Op de bovenste verdieping van het markante BINK36 gebouw in Den Haag.
results.name: OC070 Inspiratie- en netwerkevent - Zakelijk speeddaten

results.description:
Op donderdag 6 december vindt voor de negentiende keer de Scrum Round Table plaats. Onze vaste gasten zijn bekend met ons format: we geven wat uitleg over het onderwerp, we spelen een spel om het onderwerp beter de doorgronden en daarna hebben we een discussie om de opgedane kennis te verbreden. Tijdens deze Scrum Round Table gaan we samen het onderwerp Gamification aanpakken. We gaan proberen een goede basis voor een game te creëren, die meegenomen kan worden naar de eigen organisatie. Uiteraard sluiten we traditioneel af met een borrel.

Spreekt het onderwerp je aan? Vind je het leuk om actief mee te doen en kennis en ervaring in te brengen? Meld je dan aan via de button onderaan de pagina en help ons om dit tot een succesvolle sessie te maken.
results.name: Scrum Round Table

results.description:
How to use technology for exponential growth? Can IoT and Ai help in decision making? How to automate business processes using Ai?

Join us for an evening full of ideas, insights, and opportunities with two inspiring speakers from innovative and cutting-edge companies.

Agenda:
18:30 Doors open - Meet and greet with a drink!
18:50 Introduction
19:00 First Talk + Q&A
19:40 Break for a Pizza
20:00 Second Talk +Q&A
20:40 Networking drinks
21:30 End

About the speakers:

About KX:

By enabling countless connections between devices across the organization, the IoT provides us with opportunities to be more efficient in how we do things, saving us time, improving yields and adding value. However, the focus is moving from what the IoT could do, to what it can do. How it contributes to business goals and how it delivers value. Organizations are moving towards how the IoT, combined with ML, AI, and advanced analytics can help them extract insights, make better more timely decisions and improve revenues from sensor data.

Sean Lang, Business Development Director, will introduce you to Kx’s leading time-series database and their use cases across different sectors. He will be joined by one of Kx’ foremost ML Experts, Espe Lopez, who will deep-dive on ML use cases that Kx have implemented within Fortune 500 manufacturing companies alongside special mention to her most recent project with NASA where she developed AI tools for solar weather prediction and exoplanets identification!
Read more here:
https://kx.com/blog/kx-and-nasa-fdl-space-weather-gnss-and-exoplanets/

Since its early days as the #1 in high-frequency trading, Kx have advanced into many new sectors, became UK Tech Company of the year and are now looking to hire 1000 graduates in the next 3 years! Come along to find out more!

About HAL24K:
HAL24K is a Data Intelligence scale-up based in Amsterdam, London and San Fransisco, delivering operational and predictive intelligence to cities, countries and companies. It combines advanced data science techniques – such as machine learning and deep neural networks – with modelling, analysis and visualization through its SaaS-based Dimension platform, to enable real-time data-driven decision making in complex and multidimensional environments. This optimizes resources, avoids disruptions and saves costs.

Speakers:
Peter den Hartog: Chief Science Officer and Stanford Post Doc
Robert Siccama: CFOO and VU Amsterdam Post Doc

results.name: Scaling your business with technology (Ai & IoT)

results.description:
Technology was never neutral; its social, political, and moral impacts have become painfully clear. But the stakes will only get higher as connected cameras will watch over the city, algorithms oversee society’s most critical decisions, and transport, jobs, and even war will become automated. The tech industry hasn’t yet earned the trust these technologies demand.

Drawing on years of research for his new book Future Ethics, designer Cennydd Bowles will illuminate the moral challenges that lie ahead for technologists, and discuss how practitioners and companies can create more thoughtful, ethical products for future generations.

About Cennydd
Cennydd Bowles is a London-based designer and writer with fifteen years of experience advising clients including Twitter, Ford, Cisco, and the BBC. His focus today is the ethics of emerging technology. He has lectured on the topic at Facebook, Stanford University, and Google, and is a sought-after speaker at technology and design events worldwide. His second book, Future Ethics, was published in 2018.

Doors open: 17:30
Event starts: 18:00
results.name: Future Ethics – with Cennydd Bowles

results.description:
Altijd al willen weten waarom mensen 'ja' zeggen en vervolgens 'nee' doen? En hoe je mensen 'meekrijgt' in een verandering? Hoe je met je team tot innovatie komt? Waarom ‘top-down’ gedragsverandering niet werkt en hoe je ‘bottom-up’ kunt stimuleren? Of misschien wil je wel je burgers laten participeren maar is er nauwelijks respons? Of zijn het altijd dezelfde burgers die zich laten horen, maar wil je juist contact met de zwijgende meerderheid?

De masterclass wordt gegeven door Bas van Kesteren, groepsdynamicus met een achtergrond in Informatie Technologie (Saxion), Employee Engagement (Erasmus Universiteit) en Groupdynamics (MIT Boston).

Aanmelden kan via:
https://www.letsopp.com/college-collectieve-intelligentie-save-the-date
results.name: Collectieve Intelligentie en Groepsdynamica

results.description:
For the last time of the year we have a special 3D Cafe, all about "Humanitarian Makers".

HumanitarianMakers.org is a world-wide community of "makers" to get involved with design, development and testing of things that can be used in a Humanitarian context, like Disaster Relief and Humanitarian Aid.

One of the partners is for example Field Ready, an NGO that actively used 3D Printing and other DIY and digital fabrication based technologies to locally help in emergency situations.

We will start with an introduction to Humanitarian Makers by the Co-Founder: Naiomi Lundman. She will join us via a teleconference call.

Then we will explore if and how we can get involved with the so-called "Item testing" activities, where FabLabs and Makerspaces from all around the world help bring the cause forward.
results.name: 3D Cafe Special: Humanitarian Makers

results.description:
Altijd al willen weten waarom mensen 'ja' zeggen en vervolgens 'nee' doen? Hoe je mensen 'meekrijgt' in een verandering? Of hoe je tot ideeën kunt komen in je vergadering en niet alleen maar blijft hangen bij meningen en ongedragen oplossingen?

Tijdens ons open college dagen we je uit op een heel andere manier naar je organisatie en de mensen daarin te kijken. Je loopt naar buiten met frisse nieuwe invalshoeken, energie en praktische tips om ermee aan de slag te gaan. Durf jij het aan?

Meld je aan via:
https://www.letsopp.com/college-collectieve-intelligentie-save-the-date
